I'm still not sure if this will work as https://github.com/openstack/patrole/blob/d063b409bb7a3d056ac9d55bb6200b1076e71422/patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_rule_validation.py#L329 uses the os_primary tenant_id to derive the expected result and so using a different project_id for override_role is not correct. I would imagine there is an API for create auto-allocated topology as according to Neutron docs there are CLI commands for doing so. But even then, it might not be safe to re-create another auto-allocated topology after deleting the first one as it will result in new resource IDs getting created.

This will require a bit of rework just to make it correctly work with a different project_id and I'm not sure that's worth pursuing just to get 1 deletion test passing."}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-08-17 20:23:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> I'm still not sure if this will work as https://github.com/openstack/patrole/blob/d063b409bb7a3d056ac9d55bb6200b1076e71422/patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_rule_validation.py#L329
 > uses the os_primary tenant_id to derive the expected result and so
 > using a different project_id for override_role is not correct. I
 > would imagine there is an API for create auto-allocated topology as
 > according to Neutron docs there are CLI commands for doing so. But
 > even then, it might not be safe to re-create another auto-allocated
 > topology after deleting the first one as it will result in new
 > resource IDs getting created.
 > 
 > This will require a bit of rework just to make it correctly work
 > with a different project_id and I'm not sure that's worth pursuing
 > just to get 1 deletion test passing.

Alternatively, it would be possible to go back to the original patch where you just pass in self.os_primary.credentials.tenant_id to the delete method and use a skip check on the test for pre-provisioned credentials (i.e. after https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/ lands).

I could be mistaken and maybe deleting the auto-allocated topology for dynamic credentials is no big deal, but I suspect there could be test conflicts in the future as deleting that topology in one test could cause issues in another test where the topology won't be found."}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-20 16:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-20 16:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Alternatively, it would be possible to go back to the original
 > patch where you just pass in self.os_primary.credentials.tenant_id
 > to the delete method and use a skip check on the test for
 > pre-provisioned credentials (i.e. after https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/
 > lands).

I have no hard feelings towards any solution. In neutron-tempest-plugin they seem to just drop it and never restore:

https://github.com/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/blob/master/neutron_tempest_plugin/api/test_auto_allocated_topology.py#L115'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-20 18:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-08-20 18:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-08-20 18:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

[{'created': '2017-09-26 16:29:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix E128 line under-indented errors

E128 continuation line under-indented for visual indent
was ignored in flake/pep8 tests

This is not a good code style practice.

This change enables E128 and rework code to fix
the errors in flake.

Many dicts was reworked to also ease readability while
fixing the warnings.

While fixing E128, many lines was more than 80 characters,
so because of this is the big amount of lines changed.

Change-Id: Ia837c2727c135883b03e9ff8c682ecf2d21def81
'}]
commit_message:
Fix E128 line under-indented errors

E128 continuation line under-indented for visual indent
was ignored in flake/pep8 tests

This is not a good code style practice.

This change enables E128 and rework code to fix
the errors in flake.

Many dicts was reworked to also ease readability while
fixing the warnings.

While fixing E128, many lines was more than 80 characters,
so because of this is the big amount of lines changed.

Change-Id: Ia837c2727c135883b03e9ff8c682ecf2d21def81

commit_message:
Add .stestr and SP1_res.yaml to .gitignore

.stestr folder is created after running functional tests
with tox.
SP1_res.yaml is created in <project_root> after running
unittests

Add .stestr to list of ignored files by git.
Add SP1_res.yaml to list of ignored files by git.
Change-Id: Ida4862891ff1dabc2c611f01c79df35ddb7f8078

commit_message:
Add sanity check for kolla deploy gates

At this moment kolla deploy only checks if containers
are running but not check if services really work.
In example, nova_compute could be running but fails to run
an instance.

Depends-On: Idfe1e7ad46efac965a22b4f7fa833babf22ba375
Change-Id: Icae9d0a32bf0b56659f7915ed23876b962e91b7c

For an operable openstack cluster, time syncronization

Change-Id: I3802bbd6fdea67c92612274115f423ac72b0c28d

commit_message:
Enable chrony by default

For an operable openstack cluster, time syncronization
is needed between nodes. As we have chrony service containerized,
this change enable chrony by default.

Change-Id: I3802bbd6fdea67c92612274115f423ac72b0c28d

commit_message:
Allow serial per service

Serial was removed by default using ANSIBLE_SERIAL variable.
This change avoid to override serial value in playbooks.
Some services as Keystone or Neutron need serialized upgrades
to implement zero-downtime upgrade blueprint.

This change remove ANSIBLE_SERIAL usage and move serial
to group_vars/globals to allow user set serial deploy.
Each service have <service_name>_serial at its defaults file
pointing to main serial.

This will allow users to apply serial globally and override
per service.

Change-Id: I6f451cde34d1c84a99a6828ce424c7203c3f5256

commit_message:
Enable setting of ceilometer as a non-root user

By adding 'become' element, you can set ceilometer as non root user.

Change-Id: I146f3aec6b1270d40c02f4f7883c169aaa796239
Closes-Bug: #1798035
(cherry picked from commit 4b2d2cc128a84bd2dced764918cc33b6899f640d)

[{'created': '2018-11-02 17:50:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix stop of loopingcall

Patch [1] for switched to use eventlet Event for loopingcall events.

It may now happen that stop event is sent when other event was
already sent and loopingcall is already not running.
That cause AssertionError in eventlet.event module.

To avoid that, we should check if if loopingcall is
running before sending _abort.set().

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611807/

Closes-Bug #1800879

Change-Id: I28ad3bdb51a20350c90dee4420058c30946897e5

commit_message:
Fix stop of loopingcall

Patch [1] for switched to use eventlet Event for loopingcall events.

It may now happen that stop event is sent when other event was
already sent and loopingcall is already not running.
That cause AssertionError in eventlet.event module.

To avoid that, we should check if if loopingcall is
running before sending _abort.set().

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611807/

Closes-Bug #1800879

Change-Id: I28ad3bdb51a20350c90dee4420058c30946897e5
(cherry picked from commit 3e08f3375e2a79c04050a562f6588934638c70e9)

commit_message:
kolla-toolbox: limit openstacksdk to <0.18 version

Queens images limit python-openstackclient to 3.12.0 version but do not set
limits on openstacksdk package. In newest images we got openstacksdk 0.18.2
which does not work with 3.12.0 as you can see below:

()[root@7739bc780a41 /]# openstack
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/ansible/bin/openstack", line 7, in <module>
    from openstackclient.shell import main
  File "/opt/ansible/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstackclient/shell.py", line 29, in <module>
    from openstackclient.common import clientmanager
  File "/opt/ansible/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py", line 166, in <module>
    'openstack.cli.base',
  File "/opt/ansible/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py", line 137, in get_plugin_modules
    __import__(ep.module_name)
  File "/opt/ansible/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstackclient/network/client.py", line 17, in <module>
    from openstack import profile
ImportError: cannot import name profile

0.17.2 works fine:

Successfully installed openstacksdk-0.17.2
()[root@7739bc780a41 /]# openstack
(openstack)

Rocky images are fine.

Change-Id: Id794040daf7d13f6d76067a4b376c45488eadf7e
(cherry picked from commit a0a93f83c0947c1e7c514b86eaaaa4d528dc6c50)

commit_message:
Set default unbound_cache_min_ttl to 0 in the base job

Currently set in the base jobs: unbound_cache_min_ttl: 900

Issue here might be that unbound is not properly caching the
registry-1.docker.io dns lookup due to the min_ttl config.

Partial-Bug: #1795718

Change-Id: Iaf6b6eb5efa3f35ec67d0d2ff69ad70c84547b8c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-12 11:43:19.000000000', 'message': 'cinder-volume: Raise limits and disable cgroup limtis

The previous TasksMax << LimitNPROC I guess was made to have
some free pids for other systemd services sharing the same user,
but the TasksMax seems to be generally too low. Rather than
trying to separate Limits, lets just use the global LimitNPROC
and disable the cgroup limiter in the hope that this is enough
for all cases. Also raise it to 1048576 which seems to be the
ceph defaults, and for the ceph usecase cinder-volume actually
needs that high limits

Change-Id: Ibacaa6fc92bbc061ad0771e4a46a495577248a0e

commit_message:
cinder-volume: Raise limits and disable cgroup limtis

The previous TasksMax << LimitNPROC I guess was made to have
some free pids for other systemd services sharing the same user,
but the TasksMax seems to be too low for some production use cases.

Rather than trying to separate Limits, lets just use the global LimitNPROC
and disable the cgroup limiter in the hope that this is enough
for all cases.

Change-Id: Ibacaa6fc92bbc061ad0771e4a46a495577248a0e

According to Designate architecture documentation,

Change-Id: I696745e2d57aade6cbb0fe89e334fddf1beaafdb

commit_message:
Only designate-central and mdns require database access

According to Designate architecture documentation,
only the designate-central and mdns services require database access.

This change removes the designate::db class for generic service and
include the designate::db class for services that need it instead.

Change-Id: I696745e2d57aade6cbb0fe89e334fddf1beaafdb

subject: Add trailing slash to fernet key_repository
messages:
[{'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-11-05 09:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-11-05 09:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-11-05 09:42:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Couldn't this be something we should report as a bug if a trailing slash can break things? And/or Puppet OpenStack as a deployment framework should ensure that we fix this without the deployers having to worry about a trailing slash."}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-11-05 09:46:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Couldn't this be something we should report as a bug if a trailing
 > slash can break things? And/or Puppet OpenStack as a deployment
 > framework should ensure that we fix this without the deployers
 > having to worry about a trailing slash.

tobias-urdin it's being fixed it in keystone:- https://review.openstack.org/615516, i added a patch in poi until it's fixed in keystone, so if keystone patch is merged quickly we don't need this. But yes trailing slash is causing the issue so good to take some preventive measure."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-11-05 10:10:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks, great that it's fixed in keystone :) We can just consider this a test fix and just merge since it's fixed in keystone and will work with/without trailing slash then."}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-11-05 11:15:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-11-06 15:52:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add trailing slash to fernet key_repository

After https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611230/, fernet
tokens are rotated twice which results in authentication
issues, Need to fix the [fernet_token/key_repository] path
as it differs from [fernet_receipts/key_repository].

Change-Id: Ief3cea7a3d111bd1fa244670acf425a8691fdb2d

commit_message:
Use the Connection.baremetal adapter for ironicclient Session

The result of get_session does not respect baremetal-specific options
like baremetal_endpoint_override in clouds.yaml.

Change-Id: Idccf4a0fc055dc9b81705b9e3b632a61a8891cfa

decodestring() is deprecated alias of decodebytes()
https://docs.python.org/3/library/base64.html#base64.decodestring

'}, {'created': '2018-11-05 02:00:34.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated "decodestring()"

"decodestring()" is deprecated alias of "decodebytes()"
https://docs.python.org/3/library/base64.html#base64.decodestring

This patch replaces "base64.decodestring" with
"oslo_serialization.base64.decode_as_bytes".
The same has been done for nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610401/

Change-Id: I604afb9cd34b7ff6695031dc271930e49ed80bcf
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated "decodestring()"

"decodestring()" is deprecated alias of "decodebytes()"
https://docs.python.org/3/library/base64.html#base64.decodestring

This patch replaces "base64.decodestring" with
"oslo_serialization.base64.decode_as_bytes".
The same has been done for nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610401/

Change-Id: I604afb9cd34b7ff6695031dc271930e49ed80bcf

[{'created': '2018-09-27 13:13:04.000000000', 'message': "Don't use 'become' in CI tests

Kolla Ansible now claims [1] to support executing as a user other than
root.  We should ensure that this is tested in CI.

This change removes the 'become' from hosts in the inventory, and sets
the remote user to 'kolla', as configured via the bootstrap-servers
command. The bootstrap-servers command still needs to execute as the
zuul user and not as kolla, since kolla does not exist yet.

[1]
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+spec/ansible-specific-task-become

commit_message:
Don't use 'become' in CI tests

Kolla Ansible now claims [1] to support executing as a user other than
root.  We should ensure that this is tested in CI.

This change removes the 'become' from hosts in the inventory, and sets
the remote user to 'kolla', as configured via the bootstrap-servers
command. The bootstrap-servers command and other ansible commands
executed before it still need to execute as the zuul user and not as
kolla, since kolla does not exist yet.

The autogenerated SSH private key in passwords.yml is now added to the
zuul user's SSH config, such that it can SSH as the kolla user, which
has authorised this key.

[1]
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+spec/ansible-specific-task-become

Change-Id: I8f3587e2908bc5b8889cd6fbc01981a6186d33e6

commit_message:
Drop strict-order flag from dnsmasq invocation

Without this flag, dnsmasq prefers to ask the servers that
are known to be up, rather than hitting servers that are either
down or known to be broken. This greatly reduces responsivity
impact of broken upstream servers.

Closes-Bug: #1746000
Change-Id: Ieee4dafc578c3bda0935fcdb80faad6c342a10e9
(cherry picked from commit d3c69dc4f22ef96ad3fb66430ce703d9c2199d2e)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated compute groups

The concept of splitting the compute group into external/internal just
to specify agent_mode for Neutron DVR was deemed to be heavy handed, and
depreacated in the Pike cycle.

Now that Rocky has been released we can remove these completely for Stein.

Change-Id: I28a1eba7f40fee55a7ec41c27451e39e4d7fd8f0

commit_message:
Add a broker connector configuration

Update to add connector configuration information
so that data can be dispatched to an intermediate broker

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 13:46:42.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure the venv lib64 symlink is relative

In the resulting venv, there may be a lib64 directory which is
a symlink to the current path when building the venv. This patch
ensure that the symlink is relative, rather than something like
the following which does not work when extracted:

/tmp/openstack-venv-builder/venvs/keystone/lib

Change-Id: I1efe2b3461f2b23bd4afb63a6e0e5daa2c71da88
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure the venv lib64 symlink is relative

In the resulting venv, there may be a lib64 directory which is
a symlink to the current path when building the venv. This patch
ensure that the symlink is relative, rather than something like
the following which does not work when extracted:

/tmp/openstack-venv-builder/venvs/keystone/lib

Change-Id: I1efe2b3461f2b23bd4afb63a6e0e5daa2c71da88

commit_message:
Added task to list tempest plugins

* In tempest, we install tempest plugins from source or from distro
  but there is no visiability that tempest plugins once installed
  got discovered by tempest itself. Listing tempest plugins will
  help to debug tempest plugin related issues easily.

* Added openstack-tempest-all subpackage to install all the tempest
  plugins. The test runs can be controlled through whitelist-file.

Change-Id: If85e5e8ffe769b29d3cbe25ac23210d935b86d08

commit_message:
Add searchlight-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for searchlight-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: I3965909f216f49ce30f5698fcc9500192590005f
Story: 2003657
Task: 26153

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 08:11:31.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated "decodestring"

decodestring() is a deprecated alias, use decodebytes()
https://docs.python.org/3.1/library/base64.html#base64.decodestring

This patch helps to remove this deprecation alias by
replacing "base64.decodestring" with "oslo_serialization.base64.decode_as_bytes".
The same has been done for nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610401/

Change-Id: Ibba785b8f9b27a74344c27dc952a8782f10fa697
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated "decodestring"

decodestring() is a deprecated alias, use decodebytes()
https://docs.python.org/3.1/library/base64.html#base64.decodestring

This patch helps to remove this deprecation alias by
replacing "base64.decodestring" with "oslo_serialization.base64.decode_as_bytes".
The same has been done for nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610401/

Change-Id: Ibba785b8f9b27a74344c27dc952a8782f10fa697

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Idd57f8f22a59ad9560e97e23195fe5d01b9a5858

commit_message:
Ensure that GetHostCpusListAction.run() returns a deterministic result

As the return value of keys() isn't guaranteed to be the same between
different runs sort them so the items we add are in a predictable order

Change-Id: Ie3106b5a167f59754241e7aaf8ad1944405d5023
Closes-Bug: 1714158

commit_message:
Fix tox -e releasenotes

The releasenotes tox target fails without this patch because it
can't find sphinx-build.

This patch fixes the releasenotes tox target to use the documentation
requirements file to make sure sphinx is installed in the tox venv.

Change-Id: I55f69e1aa1b3f426cc732cc38947d70bdb0634a5

commit_message:
turn on tcpdump debug by default for ovb jobs

Determining the root cause of ironic issues
is difficult when using an unstable cloud.
By default let's dump the network traffic to
make our lives easier.

Related-Bug: #1797526
Depends-On: Ibee6ba188585f80f0f7d136c81146096cb4432c2
Change-Id: I68f05756770909bea53b288f10dd255a9e3c8129

messages:
[{'account_id': 29335, 'date': '2018-10-31 15:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-10-31 15:44:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-10-31 16:06:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add Windows Event Log handler

The Python built-in logging module already provides a Windows Event
Log handler. This change ensures that oslo.log exposes it.

Change-Id: I287260b5046c88c433dfa66064da14faf15610e0

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28433, 'date': '2018-10-17 19:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28433, 'date': '2018-10-17 19:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-17 21:01:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

The changes between PS9 and PS10 don't really answer/document any of the questions/issues raised in PS9, and it seems like those would be good to document as justification for why this is a useful feature."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-17 22:53:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

So where are we at?  Given that the HPET was not removed for security reasons, do we even need a config option for operators to enable/disable it?

If we allow it unconditionally for all x86 hosts then we don't need a trait since we can just key off the architecture for scheduling.  This would point towards using a regular flavor extra-spec or image property rather than a trait."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-10-18 13:13:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-18 13:31:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-23 01:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-10-23 04:55:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)

If there are any virt driver can't support HPET, then we can go to use trait. If all the virt driver support HPET, then we can use extra spec I guess?"}, {'account_id': 28433, 'date': '2018-10-26 17:14:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Based on all the discussions, it seems HPET is not recommended from libvirt guys as a choice of modern timers. It's main purpose of existence as of now is to support legacy x86 systems that still require it (due to security reasons?). If we all agree to determine HPET support based on architecture(x86) then there is really no need to have traits. We could just use a key hw:hpet in flavor extra spec and/or image properties, with flavor overwrites that of image properties if there are any discrepancy. Libvirt could check architecture supports it (amid could be a simulated) and failure to schedule if need to."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-26 21:33:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

If it's as simple as just adding a new image property because it's not some kind of security related issue people would want to disable, and maybe (or maybe not) tied to arch of the guest image, then it seems just having an image property would be OK, especially since it sounds like it's really just a use case for legacy OSes (VxWorks). I'm not even sure why we'd want to have a flavor extra spec for it since it seems purely image-related and not resource-related."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-10-29 09:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28433, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 28433, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Updated to a simpler approach to use just image property instead of traits, based on feedback from Chris and Matt.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-29 16:09:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(6 comments)

some suggestions for minor tweaks'}, {'account_id': 28433, 'date': '2018-10-29 18:18:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28433, 'date': '2018-10-29 18:19:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-10-30 02:09:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

LGTM, this is much simpler, but I feel we should cleanup some of text about traits'}, {'account_id': 28433, 'date': '2018-10-30 14:42:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 28433, 'date': '2018-10-30 14:42:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
High Precision Event Timer (HPET) on x86 guests

Support HPET for x86 guests in the libvirt driver.

blueprint: support-hpet-on-guest
Co-Authored-By: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I26c5f5386b99f88dcc7f6ea4629a61f93084b3e7
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 11:23:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix redfish test_get_system_resource_not_found test

[1] improved the sushy mocks, but did not properly use
sushy.exceptions.ResourceNotFoundError (missing arguments). This
slipped in because the CI jobs do not install sushy, so this code
was never exercised.

This commit adds the required parameters to the ResourceNotFoundError
constructor.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/615621

Change-Id: I8b3d28fde0e89525d5968a33f0a6b89536ef1162
'}, {'created': '2018-11-06 11:40:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix redfish test_get_system_resource_not_found test

commit_message:
Fix redfish test_get_system_resource_not_found test

[1] improved the sushy mocks, but did not properly use
sushy.exceptions.ResourceNotFoundError (missing arguments). This
slipped in because the CI jobs do not install sushy, so this code
was never exercised.

This commit adds the required parameters to the ResourceNotFoundError
constructor.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/615621

Change-Id: I8b3d28fde0e89525d5968a33f0a6b89536ef1162

The cluster name is useful to identify resources created in different
k8s clusters, especially in the cloud environment, the cluster name is
always injected into the name of the cloud resources(e.g. the load
balancer, volume, etc.), which is helpful for the cluster resource

commit_message:
[K8S] Pass cluster name to controller-manager

The cluster name is useful to identify resources created in different
k8s clusters, especially in the cloud environment, the cluster name is
always injected into the name of the cloud resources(e.g. the load
balancer, volume, etc.), which is helpful for the cluster resource
clean up.

The magnum cluster UUID is used as the value of '--cluster-name' option.

Story: 2004242
Task: 27766
Change-Id: I245a8869948a0b8bfa8d5cc32e7fb9277477026a
(cherry picked from commit 5d1eab9d9f896f6adf5a31a17c43995377a93f78)

commit_message:
monasca-agent: switch to systemd supervision

As of stable/rocky upstream got rid of supervisor and recommends systemd
supervision for the Monasca agent's component services (collector, forwarder,
statsd). This commit adds the required systemd services and a systemd target to
tie them together. It also removes the supervisor dependency.

Change-Id: I26c89d3d49e0aa68bae54c5ff120e27292fa0b03

subject: Move ensure_consumer to a new placement.handlers.util
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 9708, 'name': 'Balazs Gibizer', 'display_name': 'gibi', 'email': 'gibizer@gmail.com', 'username': 'gibi'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-30 17:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-31 16:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Looks sane'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:00:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

There's a reason this was in the API layer, not the DB layer."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:04:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> There's a reason this was in the API layer, not the DB layer.

We don't have an api layer any more. It's all API layer.

But if we want it to not be in the db package, that's fine, but it needs to be in a different file from util.py for the reasons described. Do you have a preferred location?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:07:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > There's a reason this was in the API layer, not the DB layer.
 > 
 > We don't have an api layer any more. It's all API layer.

handlers/ is the API layer now...

 > But if we want it to not be in the db package, that's fine, but it
 > needs to be in a different file from util.py for the reasons
 > described. Do you have a preferred location?

handlers/util.py would be fine by me.

thanks,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > > There's a reason this was in the API layer, not the DB layer.
 > >
 > > We don't have an api layer any more. It's all API layer.
 > 
 > handlers/ is the API layer now...

No, that's where the handlers go, which are a specific thing (a set of individual wsgi apps that are composed into the placement wsgi app). It's not quite the same thing as "all the stuff that makes up the api". I very much don't want to put files in the handlers package that are not representing handlers.

Got a second choice?

As things currently stand the methods in util.py (except for ensure_consumer) do not need access to either the db or the OVOs, that seems worth preserving. I put ensure_consumer in the db, because that's what it is doing: ensuring consumers in the db. It's true it cares about microversions and raises HTTP exceptions, so that's potentially an issue, but so does stuff in objects, so perhaps it could go in there.

Another option (which I'm willing to pursue if people prefer) is to raise non http exceptions out of ensure_consumer and catch those in handlers/allocation (which is the sole caller of ensure_consumer) and leave it in db/util.py (or objects/util.py might be more idiomatic).'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:42:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Another option (which I'm willing to pursue if people prefer) is to raise non http exceptions out of ensure_consumer and catch those in handlers/allocation (which is the sole caller of ensure_consumer) and leave it in db/util.py (or objects/util.py might be more idiomatic).

That's what I was going to suggest."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:45:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > > > There's a reason this was in the API layer, not the DB layer.
 > > >
 > > > We don't have an api layer any more. It's all API layer.
 > >
 > > handlers/ is the API layer now...
 > 
 > No, that's where the handlers go, which are a specific thing (a set
 > of individual wsgi apps that are composed into the placement wsgi
 > app). It's not quite the same thing as "all the stuff that makes up
 > the api". I very much don't want to put files in the handlers
 > package that are not representing handlers.

And I very much don't want to put code that references microversion behaviour differences or raises HTTP exceptions in object or DB code. :)

 > Got a second choice?
 > 
 > As things currently stand the methods in util.py (except for
 > ensure_consumer) do not need access to either the db or the OVOs,
 > that seems worth preserving. I put ensure_consumer in the db,
 > because that's what it is doing: ensuring consumers in the db. It's
 > true it cares about microversions and raises HTTP exceptions, so
 > that's potentially an issue, but so does stuff in objects

Nothing I'm aware of in /objects raises HTTP exceptions. Nothing in /objects references or switches conditionals based on microversion behaviour. I have specifically tried to prevent any of that stuff from getting into that layer.

, so
 > perhaps it could go in there.
 > 
 > Another option (which I'm willing to pursue if people prefer) is to
 > raise non http exceptions out of ensure_consumer and catch those in
 > handlers/allocation (which is the sole caller of ensure_consumer)
 > and leave it in db/util.py (or objects/util.py might be more
 > idiomatic).

If handlers/allocation is the sole caller of ensure_consumer(), doesn't that mean that handlers/util.py is a good place for ensure_consumer() to go?

-jay'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:53:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> And I very much don't want to put code that references microversion
 > behaviour differences or raises HTTP exceptions in object or DB
 > code. :)

Fair enough. I agree with that. But taken to a logical extreme we should haven't db stuff in the objects :) but we went with that because it is convenient.

 > If handlers/allocation is the sole caller of ensure_consumer(),
 > doesn't that mean that handlers/util.py is a good place for
 > ensure_consumer() to go?

Well, except for the fact that it is not handler, shouldn't go in there, but I'm not willing to either care that much or fight about it, so I'll change it just so we can keep things moving well.

 > 
 > -jay"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-31 20:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-31 20:49:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-02 10:30:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-11-02 15:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-11-05 12:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-11-06 12:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Clean refactoring. LGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 17:06:44.000000000', 'message': "Move ensure_consumer to a new placement.db.util

The driving reason for this change is to allow the placement.db_api
module to be able, in subsequent patches, to import generic utility
routines from placement.util without causing an cyclical import.

As it happens, however, it also makes sense for ensure_consumer to
be within the db package, because it is a db-related utility method.
There's probably scope for some of the methods in placement.objects
to move as well, but this change doesn't do that to keep things
relatively contained.

Relevant unit test are moved, and the callers of ensure_consumer are
updated to reflect the new location.

Change-Id: Ifd1b10e5568b9d6f641e396c3c49101901daff31

The driving reason for this change is to allow the placement.db_api

It is moved into the handlers package because the only caller is

Relevant unit test are moved, and the callers of ensure_consumer are

Change-Id: Ifd1b10e5568b9d6f641e396c3c49101901daff31

commit_message:
Move ensure_consumer to a new placement.handlers.util

The driving reason for this change is to allow the placement.db_api
module to be able, in subsequent patches, to import generic utility
routines from placement.util without causing an cyclical import.

It is moved into the handlers package because the only caller is
in there too (in allocation.py).

Relevant unit test are moved, and the callers of ensure_consumer are
updated to reflect the new location.

Change-Id: Ifd1b10e5568b9d6f641e396c3c49101901daff31

commit_message:
Expose the Libvirt cpu_model and cpu_model_extra_flags options

Being able to set cpu_mode to "custom" is nice but doesn't do us
much good if users then have to resort to nova_nova_conf_overrides
to set cpu_model and/or cpu_model_extra_flags.

Instead, honor nova_cpu_model and nova_cpu_model_extra_flags variable.
Also add a release note saying that for those users who did previously
set these flags via nova_nova_conf_overrides, they should move
those bits to the newly understood variables.

Change-Id: I889e70826c5c631b86305b512b86fba2b89521b4

commit_message:
Fix associating firewall group with DVR/L3HA port

This commit enables to specify DVR/L3HA port for firewall group. We can
select a port with following device_owner in creating/updating firewall
group.

    * DVR:  'network:router_interface_distributed'
    * L3HA: 'network:ha_router_replicated_interface'

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <annp@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I05f0f652f3e43d5c1ce5ae7933991cf92a418920
Closes-Bug: #1762454
(cherry picked from commit f8e4a193e7930c2e9ef169c6e3be53a3e2a39dbe)

commit_message:
Fix ironic configuration for new oslo messaging

New version of oslo messaging has deprecated some
ironic parameters like most rabbit_*.
This patchset fixes this issue but remains compatible
with former versions.

Change-Id: Ia8ede2c853626251613b9c700cf173b62b79ba71
(cherry picked from commit 5a688a0110fd813b197013fe662ff5bd25c13215)

commit_message:
Usage of systemd services is mapped to the host group

Previously all ceilometer services were deployed to all hosts.
But, notification agent is most cases has nothing to do with
nova-compute hosts. So condition has been added in order to
differentiate services based on their groups.

Change-Id: I7bf1a2ef605f6645aa10787b1a53e8a63034cead

commit_message:
Add syslinux as a dependency for ironic-pxe

Previously it was a dependency for syslinux-tftpboot, but that's no
longer the case. So lets add it manually here.

Related-Bug: #1801824
Change-Id: I91e7b3c189774fc282e7e085bc3920058ca3fbd1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-01 12:31:26.000000000', 'message': "Always run upgrades/updates as tripleo-admin

This change has two main parts:

* Ensure that when we ssh *via Mistral*, we always use
  tripleo-admin. `--ssh-user` argument to any update/upgrade run
  commands is now deprecated. The reason i didn't remove it completely
  is that how current upgrade commands use ssh needed some mental
  untangling, and i want us to keep an easy way back in case my
  understanding is wrong here. Deprecation seems safer than outright
  removal.

* On upgrade prepare and FFWD prepare, make sure that the
  tripleo-admin user is created and authorized.

  Note that for tripleo-admin creation and authorization, the
  `--overcloud-ssh-user` parameter is used, and that one still
  defaults to `heat-admin`, which is correct. So initially we connect
  via whatever credentials user provided (which works on Nova+Ironic
  envs unless user customized it), and from that point on we always
  use tripleo-admin, which is common for all environments regardless
  of any user customizations. This is how deployment already works
  now, and after this change upgrades will work that way too.

Change-Id: Ib1a75a0a3f3b2a3bec00d8820c3a097620fa6256
Closes-Bug: #1801066

Change-Id: Ib1a75a0a3f3b2a3bec00d8820c3a097620fa6256
Closes-Bug: #1801066
"}]
commit_message:
Always run upgrades/updates as tripleo-admin

This change has two main parts:

* Ensure that when we ssh *via Mistral*, we always use
  tripleo-admin. `--ssh-user` argument to any update/upgrade run
  commands is now deprecated. The reason i didn't remove it completely
  is that how current upgrade commands use ssh needed some mental
  untangling, and i want us to keep an easy way back in case my
  understanding is wrong here. Deprecation seems safer than outright
  removal.

* On upgrade prepare and FFWD prepare, make sure that the
  tripleo-admin user is created and authorized.

  Note that for tripleo-admin creation and authorization, the
  `--overcloud-ssh-user` parameter is used, and that one still
  defaults to `heat-admin`, which is correct. So initially we connect
  via whatever credentials user provided (which works on Nova+Ironic
  envs unless user customized it), and from that point on we always
  use tripleo-admin, which is common for all environments regardless
  of any user customizations. This is how deployment already works
  now, and after this change upgrades will work that way too.

Change-Id: Ib1a75a0a3f3b2a3bec00d8820c3a097620fa6256
Closes-Bug: #1801066

commit_message:
Use openstackclient instead of neutronclient

The python-neutronclient is deprecated. We should use openstackclient
and openstacksdk for the equivalent functionality.

Change-Id: Iaf49d6b7942343104e0b40b6db89b78a793b858b
(cherry picked from commit 9691d53009d64beb442db941106708aa08466fdc)

'}, {'created': '2018-08-24 08:29:53.000000000', 'message': 'Test upgrades in CI

There is currently no coverage of upgrades in CI, which leaves us open
to regression in this infrequently tested but crucial area. This change
adds the required scripts and Zuul configuration.

A control plane is first deployed using the Kayobe stable/pike branch
and associated default configuration. The control plane is tested by
deploying then deleting a server instance. An upgrade to Queens is
performed, using the Kayobe master branch, or code in review if
applicable. The upgraded control plane is tested by deploying then
deleting a second server instance.

A workaround was required to restart the nova_compute service after the
upgrade, since the SIGHUP sent to it by Kolla Ansible during upgrade
appeared to be putting it into a degraded state.

A future improvement to this test could be to leave a server instance
running during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I0e595524e39d1131fe3ec6aaf2aeec3ff3d6a536
Story: 2003472
Task: 24732

commit_message:
Test upgrades in CI

There is currently no coverage of upgrades in CI, which leaves us open
to regression in this infrequently tested but crucial area. This change
adds the required scripts and Zuul configuration.

A control plane is first deployed using the Kayobe stable/pike branch
and associated default configuration. The control plane is tested by
deploying then deleting a server instance. An upgrade to Queens is
performed, using the Kayobe master branch, or code in review if
applicable. The upgraded control plane is tested by deploying then
deleting a second server instance.

A workaround was required to restart the nova_compute service after the
upgrade, since the SIGHUP sent to it by Kolla Ansible during upgrade
appeared to be putting it into a degraded state.

A future improvement to this test could be to leave a server instance
running during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I0e595524e39d1131fe3ec6aaf2aeec3ff3d6a536
Story: 2003472
Task: 24732

commit_message:
tasks: cinder_qos: Use the new OpenStack CLI client

Previous fix that changed grep options broke things even more.
This commit changes way how we create and associate QoS rules utilising
python-openstackclient.
It handles correctly cases where names contain their fragments in other.

Related-Bug: #1741990
Change-Id: If6181059f1bb1f582537ebe646f81c0a8d33d59c
(cherry picked from commit 86a5ddc49cbe4049fe9ca3c9343ef2385de7422a)

subject: Remove oslo_i18n.enable_lazy()
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 09:15:03.000000000', 'message': 'Remove oslo_i18n.enable_lazy()

This removes the call of the enable_lazy() function from oslo_i18n.

This function causes TypeErrors for upgrade checks, and is currently in a
deprecation process. See links:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-November/136285.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-November/136289.html

Change-Id: I373f71abf8f4cccf2e173e59459ef7ce2c35fc31
'}]
commit_message:
Remove oslo_i18n.enable_lazy()

This removes the call of the enable_lazy() function from oslo_i18n.

This function causes TypeErrors for upgrade checks, and is currently in a
deprecation process. See links:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-November/136285.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-November/136289.html

Change-Id: I373f71abf8f4cccf2e173e59459ef7ce2c35fc31

commit_message:
fixed memcached is not restarted when config changed

That's because instead of start_container we need to
use recreate_or_restart_container in handler.

Change-Id: I3bb0a4c38b9024b2e2e26bfc06cb143bb5d35317
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2fde95ca0846d4f4c94abf5993cd9469f6a4058a)

commit_message:
Add notifications about changed status to worker

- Add to_dict method for all models
- Add notifications to database, lifecycle and amphora_driver tasks
- Add information about type of action to all flows
- Add unit tests for all new functionality

Change-Id: I5df0df67be60abc0888e737b5a0f0b80dafd849d
Story: 2004122

commit_message:
Make sure that the _member_ role is assigned to admin.

When we switch to not using instack_undercloud, we missed the role
assignment that was done in there.

By simply adding it to the puppet role we get it back.

Change-Id: I074d2878ee9cfc6061d68ecd989832c636c065ec
Closes-Bug: #1799177

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-11 14:42:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix use of --ask-vault-pass argument

Currently, this argument does not work correctly, since the vault
password is not passed to kayobe via $KAYOBE_VAULT_PASSWORD, meaning
that it cannot update the kolla-ansible passwords.yml file.

It also works non-optimally, since every invocation of ansible-playbook
will prompt for a password.

This change fixes the issue by prompting for a password once in the
kayobe CLI, and storing the password in the $KAYOBE_VAULT_PASSWORD
environment variable. The kayobe-vault-password-helper command is then
used as the --vault-password-file to ansible-playbook, and the helper
pulls the password out of the environment.

Change-Id: I88b1b7b9e9be15b52e730d353ce1b1a6feacceb8
Story: 2001664
Task: 27009

commit_message:
Fix use of --ask-vault-pass argument

Currently, this argument does not work correctly, since the vault
password is not passed to kayobe via $KAYOBE_VAULT_PASSWORD, meaning
that it cannot update the kolla-ansible passwords.yml file.

It also works non-optimally, since every invocation of ansible-playbook
will prompt for a password.

This change fixes the issue by prompting for a password once in the
kayobe CLI, and storing the password in the $KAYOBE_VAULT_PASSWORD
environment variable. The kayobe-vault-password-helper command is then
used as the --vault-password-file to ansible-playbook, and the helper
pulls the password out of the environment.

Change-Id: I88b1b7b9e9be15b52e730d353ce1b1a6feacceb8
Story: 2001664
Task: 27009

[{'created': '2018-08-02 09:42:42.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Use kolla variable to set inspector DHCP config

Do not merge: Depends on kolla-ansible Rocky release.

Fixes an issue with ironic prechecks, which now require
ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range to be set when ironic is enabled.

Also uses the new kolla variable ironic_dnsmasq_default_gateway to
configure the gateway for the inspection network.

These changes mean that we can drop our custom override of
ironic-dnsmasq.conf, since it now matches the file in kolla ansible.

Change-Id: I0b2e094904772fc6e14f1916e20ef207161ec001

commit_message:
Use kolla variable to set inspector DHCP config

Fixes an issue with ironic prechecks, which now require
ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range to be set when ironic is enabled.

Also uses the new kolla variable ironic_dnsmasq_default_gateway to
configure the gateway for the inspection network.

These changes mean that we can drop our custom override of
ironic-dnsmasq.conf, since it now matches the file in kolla ansible.

This change depends on the Rocky release of Kolla Ansible.

Change-Id: I0b2e094904772fc6e14f1916e20ef207161ec001

(1 comment)

I can create a service with type loadbalancer, but I don't see the cluster uuid anywhere.

Where should I look?

I'm using k8s 1.11.2"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-11-02 21:00:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I can create a service with type loadbalancer, but I don't see the
 > cluster uuid anywhere.
 > 
 > Where should I look?
 > 
 > I'm using k8s 1.11.2

k8s v1.11.2 still uses the naming convention 'a' + serviceName as load balancer name of the LB type service, you can test the cluster name by creating PersistentVolume using cinder as StorageClass.

We will fix the load balancer name format by using cluster name in k8s, but passing a unique cluster name from magnum is the prerequisite."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-11-02 21:00:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
[K8S] Pass cluster name to controller-manager

The cluster name is useful to identify resources created in different
k8s clusters, especially in the cloud environment, the cluster name is
always injected into the name of the cloud resources(e.g. the load
balancer, volume, etc.), which is helpful for the cluster resource
clean up.

The magnum cluster UUID is used as the value of '--cluster-name' option.

Story: 2004242
Task: 27766
Change-Id: I245a8869948a0b8bfa8d5cc32e7fb9277477026a

commit_message:
Always requires for a tenant network when creating a VM

This bug is related with a race condition that happens
when a test case creates a shared network and such network
is pick up from another test that is requiring one
without creating it and is running in the same time.

Change-Id: I8d7de49c27b05f1bbabeba0f49625c8766931367
Related-Bug: #1753211
Related-Bug: #1753209

which does not work with 3.12.0 as you can see below:

commit_message:
kolla-toolbox: limit openstacksdk to <0.18 version

Queens images limit python-openstackclient to 3.12.0 version but do not set
limits on openstacksdk package. In newest images we got openstacksdk 0.18.2
which does not work with 3.12.0 as you can see below:

()[root@7739bc780a41 /]# openstack
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/ansible/bin/openstack", line 7, in <module>
    from openstackclient.shell import main
  File "/opt/ansible/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstackclient/shell.py", line 29, in <module>
    from openstackclient.common import clientmanager
  File "/opt/ansible/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py", line 166, in <module>
    'openstack.cli.base',
  File "/opt/ansible/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py", line 137, in get_plugin_modules
    __import__(ep.module_name)
  File "/opt/ansible/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstackclient/network/client.py", line 17, in <module>
    from openstack import profile
ImportError: cannot import name profile

0.17.2 works fine:

Successfully installed openstacksdk-0.17.2
()[root@7739bc780a41 /]# openstack
(openstack)

Rocky images are fine.

Change-Id: Id794040daf7d13f6d76067a4b376c45488eadf7e

subject: Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 07:39:57.000000000', 'message': "Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

	OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
	oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

The same has been done for Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606213

Change-Id: I9840f29b018c60b8458e39a6595797bc9b19a00c
"}]
commit_message:
Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

	OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
	oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

The same has been done for Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606213

Change-Id: I9840f29b018c60b8458e39a6595797bc9b19a00c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-05 11:31:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add time for overcloud deletion

On promotion jobs we hit problems when overcloud-deletion is
finished too late and we stop the job before, which leads to
failures.
Add time to wait for overcloud delete.
Change-Id: Idb4079b42cb69d7bddc8dd19817da79d49e1dcb3
Related-Bug: #1801525
'}]
commit_message:
Add time for overcloud deletion

On promotion jobs we hit problems when overcloud-deletion is
finished too late and we stop the job before, which leads to
failures.
Add time to wait for overcloud delete.
Change-Id: Idb4079b42cb69d7bddc8dd19817da79d49e1dcb3
Related-Bug: #1801525

and you cannot execute commands in it the ns. The sidecars don't seem to launch either. I'll investigate."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-22 18:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

1 comment on nsenter command. Please take a look. It comes from Podman folks.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-10-23 17:22:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(10 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-10-24 07:00:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2018-10-24 11:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> (1 comment)

Cedric and I have been looking at network namespace problems and through experimentation I came up with a variation for podman that at least brought up the sidecar containers. I changed the CLI to:

"nsenter --net=/run/netns/${NETNS} -p --preserve-credentials -m  -t 1 podman"

and removed the "ip netns exec" from the container entry point command line. For example instead of:

   ip netns exec /usr/sbin/dnsmasq -k $ARGS

it would simply be:

   /usr/sbin/dnsmasq -k $ARGS

I wasn't able to bring up a VM yet but it wasn't failing on network operations AFAICT. I will look into this later on today.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-10-24 12:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

I'm running into issues with network namespaces with and without wrappers enabled when using podman. It's a bit worse with wrappers enabled, but I suspect its just that the things are messed up just get "more so". I'm thinking that it might be best to land this, enabling more people to test it and iterate to sort out what is going on with podman. Last I tested this seemed to work fine with docker.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-05 20:39:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Patch Set 25 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-11-06 00:24:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-28 14:17:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix wrapper containers for podman w/o sockets

Adapt wrapper containers for podman, which has no
a socket available. Remove bind_socket for the wrappers.

Additionally, add debug trigger for the wrapper scripts messages to
become captured to the wrapper containers' stdout.

Run the wrapper containers unprivileged but added SYS_ADMIN
capability.

Ensure there is only one a wrapper container is running per an agent
container, which has it name matching the wanted netns/nedid. Remove
orphaned leftovers (when a name does not match the identified
netns/netid) and duplicating wrapper containers, if any.

Change-Id: Ib3c41a8bee349856d21f360595e41a9eafd79323
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-10-01 14:04:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix wrapper containers for podman w/o sockets

Adapt wrapper containers for podman, which has no
a socket available. Remove bind_socket for the wrappers.

Additionally, add debug trigger for the wrapper scripts messages to
become captured to the wrapper containers' stdout.

Do not stop and remove the existing container before launching a new
one. Allow the neutron parent process to control the process life
cycle. Although make the wraper containers cleaning up any exited
containers after its main process terminated by the neutron parent
process. Additionally, If a name is already taken by a container,
give it an unique name and assume all the smooth transitioning work
to be done by the parent neutron process and that clean up logic
in the wrapper.

Change-Id: Ib3c41a8bee349856d21f360595e41a9eafd79323
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

"}, {'created': '2018-10-09 15:51:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix wrapper containers for podman w/o sockets

Adapt wrapper containers for podman, which has no a socket available.

Add container_cli parameter for base neutron class, default to docker.
Possible values: podman/docker (default). It is used by the wrappers
tooling to issue CLI commands to the host containers system.
Deprecate bind_socket so it does nothing for podman CLI.

Additionally, add debug triggers for the wrapper scripts messages to
become captured to the wrapper containers' stdout.

Do not stop and remove the existing container before launching a new
one. Allow the neutron parent process to control the process life
cycle. Although make the wraper containers cleaning up any exited
containers after its main process terminated by the neutron parent
process. Additionally, If a name is already taken by a container,
give it an unique name and assume all the smooth transitioning work
to be done by the parent neutron process and that clean up logic
in the wrapper.

Change-Id: Ib3c41a8bee349856d21f360595e41a9eafd79323
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-10-09 16:40:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix wrapper containers for podman w/o sockets

Additionally, add debug triggers for the wrapper scripts messages to
become captured to the wrapper containers' stdout.

Do not stop and remove the existing container before launching a new
one. Allow the neutron parent process to control the process life
cycle. Although make the wraper containers cleaning up any exited
containers after its main process terminated by the neutron parent
process. Additionally, If a name is already taken by a container,
give it an unique name and assume all the smooth transitioning work
to be done by the parent neutron process and that clean up logic
in the wrapper.

Closes-Bug: #1799484
Change-Id: Ib3c41a8bee349856d21f360595e41a9eafd79323
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix wrapper containers for podman w/o sockets

Adapt wrapper containers for podman, which has no a socket available.

Add container_cli parameter for base neutron class, default to docker.
Possible values: podman/docker (default). It is used by the wrappers
tooling to issue CLI commands to the host containers system.
Deprecate bind_socket so it does nothing for podman CLI.

Additionally, add debug triggers for the wrapper scripts messages to
become captured to the wrapper containers' stdout.

Do not stop and remove the existing container before launching a new
one. Allow the neutron parent process to control the process life
cycle. Although make the wraper containers cleaning up any exited
containers after its main process terminated by the neutron parent
process. Additionally, If a name is already taken by a container,
give it an unique name and assume all the smooth transitioning work
to be done by the parent neutron process and that clean up logic
in the wrapper.

Closes-Bug: #1799484
Change-Id: Ib3c41a8bee349856d21f360595e41a9eafd79323
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix ironic configuration for new oslo messaging

New version of oslo messaging has deprecated some
ironic parameters like most rabbit_*.
This patchset fixes this issue but remains compatible
with former versions.

Change-Id: Ia8ede2c853626251613b9c700cf173b62b79ba71

subject: Improve error message for AggregateAlreadyHasHost exception
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-17 14:30:46.000000000', 'message': "Improve error message for AggregateAlreadyHasHost exception

If a lease fails to end properly and some reserved hosts are not removed
from its aggregate, Blazar will get a Conflict exception from novaclient
while starting a new lease on the same hosts, with an error message
describing why a host cannot be added to the new aggregate, such as:

  Cannot add host to aggregate <new_aggregate_id>. Reason: One or more
  hosts already in availability zone(s) [u'blazar_<old_aggregate_uuid>']

However, Blazar is catching this exception and raising its own
AggregateAlreadyHasHost exception with a confusing error message:

  Aggregate <new_aggregate_id> already has host(s) <hostname>

This patch changes the error message of the AggregateAlreadyHasHost
exception to correctly describe the problem and include the error
message from novaclient containing information about the old aggregate.

Change-Id: Iea865b23e185957631fccef4e0624b140f2b835e
"}]
commit_message:
Improve error message for AggregateAlreadyHasHost exception

If a lease fails to end properly and some reserved hosts are not removed
from its aggregate, Blazar will get a Conflict exception from novaclient
while starting a new lease on the same hosts, with an error message
describing why a host cannot be added to the new aggregate, such as:

  Cannot add host to aggregate <new_aggregate_id>. Reason: One or more
  hosts already in availability zone(s) [u'blazar_<old_aggregate_uuid>']

However, Blazar is catching this exception and raising its own
AggregateAlreadyHasHost exception with a confusing error message:

  Aggregate <new_aggregate_id> already has host(s) <hostname>

This patch changes the error message of the AggregateAlreadyHasHost
exception to correctly describe the problem and include the error
message from novaclient containing information about the old aggregate.

Change-Id: Iea865b23e185957631fccef4e0624b140f2b835e

commit_message:
Pass disk_info dict to libvirt_info

We currently pass all members of the disk_info dict to libvirt_info
when generating libvirt config. A subsequent change adds another key
to this dict. Rather than add a fourth argument to libvirt_info, this
pre-emptive change just passes the dict.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: I28c5bc23c0ea60d64153472d8937965f60f907c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-28 07:26:32.000000000', 'message': 'Retry executing command "nvme list" when fail

Only one NVMe connection can be active on the same Compute node, when
initiator side has more than one connection then new connection is made,
results of the new connected device is not instantaneous.

Fixing this issue requires retry and sleep when executing command
"nvme list" to retrieve the newly connected device.

Change-Id: I6b70140be7023770b83603de723d6d2de3ebb747
Closes-Bug: #1792313
(cherry picked from commit fab367cc265593ac7b46feca8cb13da1385a3d03)
'}]
commit_message:
Retry executing command "nvme list" when fail

Only one NVMe connection can be active on the same Compute node, when
initiator side has more than one connection then new connection is made,
results of the new connected device is not instantaneous.

Fixing this issue requires retry and sleep when executing command
"nvme list" to retrieve the newly connected device.

Change-Id: I6b70140be7023770b83603de723d6d2de3ebb747
Closes-Bug: #1792313
(cherry picked from commit fab367cc265593ac7b46feca8cb13da1385a3d03)

subject: Update the min version of tox to 2.0
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-05 01:16:40.000000000', 'message': 'Update the min version of tox to 2.0

The verification comands used by tox need at least 2.0 version. This
patch aims to update tox version from 1.6 to 2.0 which should help with
local running of constraints targets.

Change-Id: I327b407d267ed4ea483f3ebacb2b4440953b3fb0
'}]
commit_message:
Update the min version of tox to 2.0

The verification comands used by tox need at least 2.0 version. This
patch aims to update tox version from 1.6 to 2.0 which should help with
local running of constraints targets.

Change-Id: I327b407d267ed4ea483f3ebacb2b4440953b3fb0

commit_message:
Fix libvirt volume tests passing invalid disk_info

The tests for some libvirt volume were following the same pattern of
passing invalid disk_info data to get_config. They seemed to expect
connection_info['data'] to contain the same data as disk_info, which
has never been true.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: I0fc5ebc9eeae8feb644adaa96537e69521acec78

[{'created': '2018-10-30 11:09:33.000000000', 'message': 'Context manager to handle shared_targets

We introduced "shared_targets" and "service_uuid" fields in volumes to
allow volume consumers to protect themselves from unintended leftover
devices when handling iSCSI connections with shared targets.

The way they protect themselves from the automatic scans that happen on
detach/map race conditions is by locking and only allowing one attach or
one detach operation for each server to happen at a given time.

When using an up to date Open iSCSI initiator we don't need to use
locks, as it has the possibility to disable automatic LUN scans (which
are the real cause of the leftover devices), and OS-Brick already
supports this feature.

This is currently not the case, since Nova is blindly locking whenever
"shared_targets" is set to True.

Thanks to the context manager introduced in this patch we can improve
our separation of concerns (Nova doesn't have to care when we have to
lock), and we can fine tune the locking to only lock when the iSCSI
initiator doesn't support disabling automatic scans.

The context manager "guard_connection" lives in
"os_brick.initiator.utils" and needs a cinder volume.  The volume can be
passed as a dictionary or OVO instance.

Change-Id: I4970363301d5d1f4e7d0f07e09b34d15ee6884c3
Related-Bug: #1800515
'}, {'created': '2018-10-30 15:55:34.000000000', 'message': 'Context manager to handle shared_targets

We introduced "shared_targets" and "service_uuid" fields in volumes to
allow volume consumers to protect themselves from unintended leftover
devices when handling iSCSI connections with shared targets.

The way they protect themselves from the automatic scans that happen on
detach/map race conditions is by locking and only allowing one attach or
one detach operation for each server to happen at a given time.

When using an up to date Open iSCSI initiator we don't need to use
locks, as it has the possibility to disable automatic LUN scans (which
are the real cause of the leftover devices), and OS-Brick already
supports this feature.

This is currently not the case, since Nova is blindly locking whenever
"shared_targets" is set to True.

Thanks to the context manager introduced in this patch we can improve
our separation of concerns (Nova doesn't have to care when we have to
lock), and we can fine tune the locking to only lock when the iSCSI
initiator doesn't support disabling automatic scans.

The context manager "guard_connection" lives in
"os_brick.initiator.utils" and needs a cinder volume.  The volume can be
passed as a dictionary or OVO instance.

Change-Id: I4970363301d5d1f4e7d0f07e09b34d15ee6884c3
Related-Bug: #1800515
'}]
commit_message:
Context manager to handle shared_targets

We introduced "shared_targets" and "service_uuid" fields in volumes to
allow volume consumers to protect themselves from unintended leftover
devices when handling iSCSI connections with shared targets.

The way they protect themselves from the automatic scans that happen on
detach/map race conditions is by locking and only allowing one attach or
one detach operation for each server to happen at a given time.

When using an up to date Open iSCSI initiator we don't need to use
locks, as it has the possibility to disable automatic LUN scans (which
are the real cause of the leftover devices), and OS-Brick already
supports this feature.

This is currently not the case, since Nova is blindly locking whenever
"shared_targets" is set to True.

Thanks to the context manager introduced in this patch we can improve
our separation of concerns (Nova doesn't have to care when we have to
lock), and we can fine tune the locking to only lock when the iSCSI
initiator doesn't support disabling automatic scans.

The context manager "guard_connection" lives in
"os_brick.initiator.utils" and needs a cinder volume.  The volume can be
passed as a dictionary or OVO instance.

Change-Id: I4970363301d5d1f4e7d0f07e09b34d15ee6884c3
Related-Bug: #1800515

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-27 14:45:52.000000000', 'message': "tox: Stop building *all* docs in 'docs'

The 'docs' target currently builds the documentation trees in 'api-ref' and
'api-guide', in addition to 'doc'. This massively increases the amount of
time docs take to build both locally and in the gate. It's not necessary for
gate, since separate jobs take care of the other documents for barbican.
As such, we should stop doing it.

For users that *do* care about this (for whatever reason) a new 'all-docs'
target is included.

Change-Id: I8b65c16d7bf574f045b702de853ad81389f140d5
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Stop building *all* docs in 'docs'

The 'docs' target currently builds the documentation trees in 'api-ref' and
'api-guide', in addition to 'doc'. This massively increases the amount of
time docs take to build both locally and in the gate. It's not necessary for
gate, since separate jobs take care of the other documents for barbican.
As such, we should stop doing it.

For users that *do* care about this (for whatever reason) a new 'all-docs'
target is included.

Change-Id: I8b65c16d7bf574f045b702de853ad81389f140d5

subject: Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 06:37:59.000000000', 'message': "Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

  OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
  oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

The same has been done for Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606213

Change-Id: Iff2ad3d20f7f14da732a0c264c73f16cd98b28ad
"}]
commit_message:
Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

  OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
  oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

The same has been done for Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606213

Change-Id: Iff2ad3d20f7f14da732a0c264c73f16cd98b28ad

commit_message:
Skip trying to set OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE, and PUBLIC_INTERFACE up if mapping set

For more complex neutron network configurations your supposed to use
OVS_BRIDGE_MAPPINGS instead of OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE, PHYSICAL_NETWORK,
and PUBLIC_INTERFACE, and neutron doesn't create the OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE
bridge if OVS_BRIDGE_MAPPINGS is specified [1], which results in the
start_mutnauq_l2_agent and create_neutron_initial_network functions
throwing errors if OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE doesn't exist.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/neutron_plugins/openvswitch_agent#L41-L49

Change-Id: Ibc31defbeeb8105ad6105a326dd0193ea6de778f

commit_message:
Adds subnormal path for placement client (2)

We start to support placement api from Stein, so there are cases where
the resource classs of the reservation id doesn't exist if the
reservation been created before Rocky release.

This patch changes the placement client code to be aware of the cases.
Namely, in cases the resource class is not found, this patch changes
delete_reservation_inventory() and delete_reservation_class() to skip
the operation.

Change-Id: I5c4a4b8c90f237fa392c2a3ae3ffc9be64df7d64
Blueprint: placement-api

commit_message:
Adds subnormal path for placement client (1)

We start to support placement api from Stein, so there are cases where
the child resource provider of a host doesn't exist if the host has
been created in blazar before Rocky release.

This patch changes the placement client code to be aware of the cases.
Namely, in cases the resource provider is not found,

- Change get_resource_provider() to return None
- Change delete_reservation_provider() to skip the operation
- Change update_reservation_inventory() to create the resource provider
- Change delete_reservation_inventory() to raise an error

Change-Id: I82abbc73f69f4036f60b7c549c1cbd0c0b91a130
Blueprint: placement-api

subject: Update min tox version to 2.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 28956, 'date': '2018-11-02 16:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-04 12:53:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

xstatic-xxx repositories actually do not use tox at all.
They do not use constraints file.
Which situation do we need tox >= 2.0?

Instead I will propose the usage of tox,
but if you don't understand the whole context, you should not touch it."}, {'account_id': 28956, 'date': '2018-11-06 06:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Akihiro Motoki,
I got it. Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 28956, 'date': '2018-11-06 06:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 16:42:00.000000000', 'message': 'Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.
Update to reflect reality, which should help with local running of
constraints targets.

Change-Id: Iea9a3f6b7e99a1d7f3ccb53fe1dd883767056a83
'}]
commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.
Update to reflect reality, which should help with local running of
constraints targets.

Change-Id: Iea9a3f6b7e99a1d7f3ccb53fe1dd883767056a83

commit_message:
Smarter containerization defaults

We use the release-sensitive defaults for containerized_* variables in
many CI feturesets, but not when deploying a dev setup without a
featureset. Use them by default so that devs don't have to deploy a
specific featureset to get a working environment.

Change-Id: Iff509f4dc09862a451ad5cf915aa7764a314c28c
Depends-On: Ia54eb8988225d0b45787ab89948d2c610c27257a
Closes-Bug: #1798593

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 03:20:41.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia46b85cad73506688279d8a9f638b1bd99a95038
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia46b85cad73506688279d8a9f638b1bd99a95038

commit_message:
Add senlin-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for senlin-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: Ic890a04156abf201ac618ce71ccddcc4544d0acf
Story: 2003657
Task: 26154

commit_message:
Use container_cli for post_upgrade_tasks & external_upgrade_tasks

- Export container_cli for post_upgrade_tasks & external_deploy_tasks
  and external_upgrade_tasks
- Replace "docker exec" by {{ container_cli }} exec in these tasks
  (cinder, nova, mysql, ironic and TLS).

Depends-On: Iff509f4dc09862a451ad5cf915aa7764a314c28c
Change-Id: I7b11f44c9255294863879aaff88d0dd1672bff6e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 15:12:02.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: Ia981b27852b9061c8a406e68388c60595aa528f8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: Ia981b27852b9061c8a406e68388c60595aa528f8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
