[{'created': '2018-10-25 16:44:14.000000000', 'message': 'Run Mistral workflow to make temporary Swift URLs on upgrade

The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow was getting run
on overcloud deploy but not upgrade because it was called only
on the task split for the clone_git_repo task. This patch ensures
it is run regardless of if the call to clone_git_repo is necessary.
The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow is used by Ceph and
Swift so in theory this was a bug for Swift upgrades too.

Change-Id: Ifab82c9a5b0a206c14ae7976d2c1c7f0e9fa3d9d
Closes-Bug: #1799945
'}, {'created': '2018-10-27 19:08:49.000000000', 'message': "Run Mistral workflow to make temporary Swift URLs on upgrade

The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow was getting run
on overcloud deploy but not upgrade because it was called only
on the task split for the clone_git_repo task. This patch ensures
it is run regardless of if the call to clone_git_repo is necessary.
The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow is used by Ceph and
Swift so in theory this was a bug for Swift upgrades too.

Also, updates rename_ceph_ansible_fetch_directory.yaml's notify_zaqar
task to send a meaningful message, as previously the workflow failed
because it tried to reference a variable as if it were a task.

Change-Id: Ifab82c9a5b0a206c14ae7976d2c1c7f0e9fa3d9d
Closes-Bug: #1799945
"}]
commit_message:
Run Mistral workflow to make temporary Swift URLs on upgrade

The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow was getting run
on overcloud deploy but not upgrade because it was called only
on the task split for the clone_git_repo task. This patch ensures
it is run regardless of if the call to clone_git_repo is necessary.
The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow is used by Ceph and
Swift so in theory this was a bug for Swift upgrades too.

Also, updates rename_ceph_ansible_fetch_directory.yaml's notify_zaqar
task to send a meaningful message, as previously the workflow failed
because it tried to reference a variable as if it were a task.

Change-Id: Ifab82c9a5b0a206c14ae7976d2c1c7f0e9fa3d9d
Closes-Bug: #1799945

[{'created': '2018-11-05 17:34:22.000000000', 'message': 'Improve sushy mocks

This patch adds some missing objects to sushy mocking (through the
third-party drivers specs) and changes tests to monkey-patch the
`Sushy` class rather than the `sushy` module imported into the
namespace of the modules being tested.

Also mocked `sushy` exceptions pushed to the fixtures to simplify

Change-Id: I56aafa5c8cd2a62e800615b3529c4ddd8c5394a6

commit_message:
Improve sushy mocks

This patch adds some missing objects to sushy mocking (through the
third-party drivers specs) and changes tests to monkey-patch the
`Sushy` class rather than the `sushy` module imported into the
namespace of the modules being tested.

Also mocked `sushy` exceptions pushed to the fixtures to simplify
test cases.

Change-Id: I56aafa5c8cd2a62e800615b3529c4ddd8c5394a6

subject: Fix CPU count returned by introspection in Ironic iDRAC driver

dracclient is now returning actual CPU count for each CPU socket.

If list_cpus in dracclient, it returns below values -
[CPU(id='CPU.Socket.1', cores=14, ht__enabled=True, cpu_count=28),
 CPU(id='CPU.Socket.2', cores=14, ht_enabled=True, cpu_count=28)]

As you can see in above list, there is cpu_count attribute added in

it only displays CPU value to 2 even though it is returning 56 cpus
per node.
So objective of this patch to fetch actual CPU's per socket and sum it

commit_message:
Fix CPU count returned by introspection in Ironic iDRAC driver

If list_cpus in dracclient, it returns below values -

[CPU(id='CPU.Socket.1', cores=14, ht__enabled=True),
CPU(id='CPU.Socket.2', cores=14, ht_enabled=True)]

Each CPU socket has cores with hyperthreading enabled, so if we
calculate the cpu per socket, we will get actual cpu count per socket,
So objective of this patch to fetch actual CPU's per socket and sum it

Story: #2004155
Change-Id: Ia86b0462a3e73af7a2ce0a6439286f7071f74caa

subject: Use logging for warning
messages:
[{'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-10-27 02:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-10-27 06:35:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-10-29 06:35:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Hi wangxiyuan. Thanks for the Patch. Pl address the below comments.

There's one more file which uses warnings. Pl look.
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.policy/tree/oslo_policy/generator.py#n116"}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-10-29 07:09:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-10-29 12:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-10-29 13:39:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)

ok Agreed . Did you check the above mentioned file also?'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-10-30 01:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > (1 comment)
 > 
 > ok Agreed . Did you check the above mentioned file also?

generator is used for command line tools which should not use LOG as well.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-10-30 01:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> > > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > ok Agreed . Did you check the above mentioned file also?
 > 
 > generator is used for command line tools which should not use LOG
 > as well.

ok. Thanks'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-02 13:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

What is motivating this change? Messages sent via the warnings module should already be going into the logs, and the warnings module tracks them so they do not appear repeatedly. Using the logging module directly will clutter the logs and trigger operators alarms.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-11-05 01:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> What is motivating this change? Messages sent via the warnings
 > module should already be going into the logs, and the warnings
 > module tracks them so they do not appear repeatedly. Using the
 > logging module directly will clutter the logs and trigger operators
 > alarms.

yeah, you have mentioned the reason why using logging:

Policy support deprecation, if a policy is a deprecated one, it should log warning. But warnings module only log it once. If another kind of policy check coming, it won't log any more. Then operators won't know what policy is deprecated.

For example, suppose "create_vm" and "update_vm" are both deprecated, then trying to create a vm and update it. If using warning module, only "create_vm" deprecation warning is logged, "update_vm" is missing.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-05 13:43:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > What is motivating this change? Messages sent via the warnings
 > > module should already be going into the logs, and the warnings
 > > module tracks them so they do not appear repeatedly. Using the
 > > logging module directly will clutter the logs and trigger
 > operators
 > > alarms.
 > 
 > yeah, you have mentioned the reason why using logging:
 > 
 > Policy support deprecation, if a policy is a deprecated one, it
 > should log warning. But warnings module only log it once. If
 > another kind of policy check coming, it won't log any more. Then
 > operators won't know what policy is deprecated.
 > 
 > For example, suppose "create_vm" and "update_vm" are both
 > deprecated, then trying to create a vm and update it. If using
 > warning module, only "create_vm" deprecation warning is logged,
 > "update_vm" is missing.

OK. Having that sort of information in the commit message would be helpful.

I would expect the message for the different policies to be different, because it includes the policy name. And because the messages are different, I would expect both warnings to be logged one time, for each. If you are not seeing both warnings, that may mean that we have a configuration problem somewhere else with the warnings module.

Are you seeing this problem in production somewhere?'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-11-06 03:45:31.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

warning.warn works well for upstream. It's our downstream private bug."}]

commit_message:
Add vars for setting images for openshift 3.11

Add possibility to set the new container images for ocp 3.11 images
during the image prepare step.

The change hooks the variables both to the `openstack overcloud
container image prepare` command and to the generated
containers-prepare-parameter.yaml file for the image prepare workflow.

Depends-on: Ibbd5ff9d3597f5add440b92a27a2f2f669f7bdbe

Change-Id: I3d59dcd2e50f2e96a7a97cb836a791a52dd6dc9a

commit_message:
Add vars for setting gluster images for openshift

Add possibility to set openshift gluster images during the image
prepare step.

The change hooks the variables both to the `openstack overcloud
container image prepare` command and to the generated
containers-prepare-parameter.yaml file for the image prepare workflow.

Change-Id: I73df96866fcec313d72a4d91a6a63f3c6085e5c2

commit_message:
Update to OpenShift 3.11 release

This update the variables to reference v3.11 instead of 3.10 and rework
how to compute the oreg_url osa var due to DockerOpenShiftBaseImage
being deprecated.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Andr√© <m.andre@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ibbd5ff9d3597f5add440b92a27a2f2f669f7bdbe
Depends-On: I764944bda6534f6b799fa0f4fb2e7980c22b1d67
Change-Id: I569f9da7ba9312a726360a3543b920413f445cbe

commit_message:
Switch to OpenShift 3.11

Bump the default openshift tags to v3.11.0 and provide
quickstart-centos-paas repo to install needed clients on the deployed
nodes.

Depends-On: Ibbd5ff9d3597f5add440b92a27a2f2f669f7bdbe
Change-Id: I764944bda6534f6b799fa0f4fb2e7980c22b1d67

commit_message:
Add test cases to verify port number 0 for port_forwaring

Floating IP port forwarding internal or external port number should
not allow 0, otherwise you will get some ValueError exception in
neutron server.

Change-Id: I8bf8ed6f9c4b937743f8c0f998ee897e3af17459
Closes-Bug: #1799150

commit_message:
Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex.

Change-Id: I9f90e36649a92982a2b2eecca410c9acbf79d69d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 21:15:25.000000000', 'message': 'Delete old tarball from config container on download

Delete the old tarball from the config container when the
tripleo.config.get_overcloud_config action is run. This will prevent the
new tarball from also containing the old tarball, which causes the
tarball to grow in size.

Change-Id: I85c8659e16503c40e2f9ff915106040859cc03a5
Closes-Bug: #1801416
'}]
commit_message:
Delete old tarball from config container on download

Delete the old tarball from the config container when the
tripleo.config.get_overcloud_config action is run. This will prevent the
new tarball from also containing the old tarball, which causes the
tarball to grow in size.

Change-Id: I85c8659e16503c40e2f9ff915106040859cc03a5
Closes-Bug: #1801416

[{'created': '2018-11-05 18:39:13.000000000', 'message': 'Only check for one unit for container scoped rels.

When checking goal state, only look for one unit to be available
when examining container scoped relations as a principle unit only
ever has a relation with a single unit of a given subordinate
application.

Closes-Bug: #1801754

commit_message:
Only check for one unit for container scoped rels.

When checking goal state, only look for one unit to be available
when examining container scoped relations as a principle unit only
ever has a relation with a single unit of a given subordinate
application.

Change-Id: I02f34358060c98c0702d3d7b58d52427c2a0445a
Closes-Bug: #1801754

commit_message:
Remove openshift-ansible repos

We do not need the openshift-ansible package (or repos),
since we will consume it via container.

2.The files of job-create-request.json, job-update-request.json  have a
 unnecessary items "project_id"

'}]
commit_message:
Update jobs(v2) api-def

Fix some bugs of jobs(v2) in api-ref
1.The respense of "Show Jobs" is missing a "session_id" paramenter.
2.The files of job-create-request.json, job-update-request.json  have a
 unnecessary items "project_id"
3.The "project_id" is a public paramenter in freezer_action, so changed
its loaction in the files of job-get-response.json,job-list-response.json.

Change-Id: I0e24a5d5eabb1323c53c5268bbeadf4418c11fae

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ic098f8560599554e0b6bb16ae326d4d30a8a5504

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to transition plan [1],
we should have py36 testenv ready for it.

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition

Change-Id: I1b1c7608ecfd40d3ad14a773117e6a8724900e82

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-05 16:27:50.000000000', 'message': 'Remove i18n.enable_lazy() call from searchlight.cmd

Lazy translation of messages is not used in OpenStack. This
causes problems for commands which use translatable messages.
The lazy translation effort was abandoned several years ago.

Change-Id: Ia797863b74fc0a065404f94f87a519d7be61725c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove i18n.enable_lazy() call from searchlight.cmd

Lazy translation of messages is not used in OpenStack. This
causes problems for commands which use translatable messages.
The lazy translation effort was abandoned several years ago.

Change-Id: Ia797863b74fc0a065404f94f87a519d7be61725c

commit_message:
fix bug link in readme

This patch fixes the bug tracker link in the readme. It is set to
depend on a job definition change in project-config so we can use this
patch to test the new release jobs.

Change-Id: Ib723e3902db886c75daa489249f0fbeabe759c98

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-20 11:29:24.000000000', 'message': 'Update metering driver to load interface driver

Currently the metering iptables driver is using the old method
to load the interface driver. This patch allows it to load
interface driver via stevedore aliases.

commit_message:
Update metering driver to load interface driver

Currently the metering iptables driver is using the old method
to load the interface driver. This patch allows it to load
interface driver via stevedore aliases.

Change-Id: I9e3027c1ec695ec3a09db0c53a0388e406e4ced6
Related-Bug: #1504536
(cherry-picked from commit 38309ca4dc79e033a7b8384f4e9f1224c5a69524)

[{'created': '2018-11-05 12:23:36.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.
Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.
More details can be found in this mailing list post:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

'}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.
Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.
More details can be found in this mailing list post:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I6d3fc97f5971620fa593e027b8660432d444f99a

commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.
Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.
More details can be found in this mailing list post:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I1757a66caab047338e8cf4deb8983c86503613d3

commit_message:
Remove i18n.enable_lazy() call from senlin.cmd

Lazy translation of messages is not used in OpenStack. This
causes problems for commands which use translatable messages.
The lazy translation effort was abandoned several years ago.

Change-Id: I8fd7cf1234fcc80b4e1678379ee8170c6e7a1ca8
Related-Bug: #1801761

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I2a5f53013c48ca22b19412d4b99f973f90aad8c7

commit_message:
OVSNeutronAgent.rpc_loop is always called with "polling_manager"

Furthermore, "polling_manager" cannot be retrieved like in [1].
"get_polling_manager" is a generator and must be used within a
context manager.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/e5726c7bdace306e28005abb899162225306d09f/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#L2074-L2076

Change-Id: I7a704f63fbfee770ee214e5f233134d17ff2d7a1
Closes-Bug: #1799748

commit_message:
Set rbd_cluster_name to cope with custom cluster names

Cinder requires the Ceph cluster name to be set explicitly in
rbd_cluster_name when not 'ceph'.

Change-Id: I880184255a1f7c39ae66bd8ad7c361d65d378a0c
Closes-Bug: 1796096
(cherry picked from commit 612279161ba26ac02791e20a6eb5aa22e8ac673a)

commit_message:
Switch to Chrony by default

This change switches the default timesync service from NTP to Chrony.
With this switch, NTP is officially deprecated.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614876/
Change-Id: Iff7981ae7144c59cbc03b35ee0b1dcda5af2f6a4
Implements-Blueprint: tripleo-chrony

commit_message:
Make setuptools RPM installation optional

After merging https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614762 python setuptool
RPM is installed, this is forbidden at Fedora 28, it has a exclusion
directive at dnf.conf.

Now that we hava a cool mechanism to check presence of python modules
before install stuff, we can integrate it with setuptools too.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/316?kanban-status=1447275

Change-Id: I480a5efebb200e65f20ef40456162136be905d55

In case --wait (-w) parameter is zero, iptables-restore returns an
error.

Correct:
  [root@dev02 iptables]# iptables-restore -w 1 -W 20000 ipt

Incorrect:
  [root@dev02 iptables]# iptables-restore -w 0 -W 20000 ipt
  Option --wait-interval requires option --wait

(cherry picked from commit 84a9a5ec57421718192427bac79b968729edeb3c)

commit_message:
iptables-restore wait period cannot be zero

In case --wait (-w) parameter is zero, iptables-restore returns an
error.

Correct:
  [root@dev02 iptables]# iptables-restore -w 1 -W 20000 ipt

Incorrect:
  [root@dev02 iptables]# iptables-restore -w 0 -W 20000 ipt
  Option --wait-interval requires option --wait

Change-Id: I431fe6f637b963d61d81afed30a4fb1ec112d66c
Closes-Bug: #1800884
(cherry picked from commit 84a9a5ec57421718192427bac79b968729edeb3c)

commit_message:
Revert to coreos images hosted on quay.io

This changes the image source for the container images hosted on
quay.io back to their upstream values.

Change-Id: I4e9c9f1a844252d013331bba6b4c1b5c4ea9430b
Depends-On: I4c64848c7eb21cd4370c9be72cea842863513c01

messages:
[{'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-06-13 20:30:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-06-13 20:33:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We've run into issues with nova receiving "network-changed" events during live migration, where the main live-migration greenthread blocked waiting for a lock but kept getting preempted by other greenthreads that blocked after it on the same lock causing the migration code to hit the RPC timeout.

Enabling "fair" locks prevents this from happening and could be useful in additional places as well.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-06-13 20:34:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

If there is interest we can work on some unit tests.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-13 21:55:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-oslo.concurrency-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/73/473973/1/check/gate-oslo.concurrency-docs-ubuntu-xenial/97e4bd9//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 08s
- gate-oslo.concurrency-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/73/473973/1/check/gate-oslo.concurrency-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/8ad3b35/ : SUCCESS in 4m 59s
- gate-oslo.concurrency-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/73/473973/1/check/gate-oslo.concurrency-python27-ubuntu-xenial/8d80ac7/ : SUCCESS in 2m 43s
- gate-oslo.concurrency-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/73/473973/1/check/gate-oslo.concurrency-python35/5578767/ : FAILURE in 3m 18s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.concurrency-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/73/473973/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.concurrency-ubuntu-xenial/1d98f41/ : SUCCESS in 1h 20m 05s'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2017-11-13 02:57:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

which projects or use cases can use this fair locks ? We hope the new function can solve issues for some OpenStack projects.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-11-14 17:15:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Theoretically they could be used by any project, specifically where there is contention on a given lock.  In nova the specific case where we found it made a significant difference was the 'refresh_cache-%s' lock where the incoming network events were repeatedly grabbing the lock and preventing the post-live-migration code from making progress."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2017-12-07 19:33:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-12-11 19:03:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-12-11 21:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

Cool, I know this came up a while back on openstack-dev.  Seems like a useful thing to have in oslo.concurrency.

I left a few comments inline that I would like to see addressed before this merges, but since it sounds like it was a PoC (unit tests needed) consider me +1 on the idea.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-12-14 16:43:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-12-14 16:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-02-16 18:28:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-04-18 21:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Joshua Harlow: did you ever update fasteners to commit to ensuring that write_lock() is fair?'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-05-04 15:26:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> Joshua Harlow: did you ever update fasteners to commit to ensuring
 > that write_lock() is fair?

I don't see anything as of this writing: https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/blob/9645fabfc71b7abe9773c862d7ad7a580823857f/fasteners/lock.py#L220

Marking WIP until fasteners is updated.  Chris, maybe you could submit the PR to fasteners to document that the write lock is fair?"}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-05-24 18:26:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Working on it :)'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-05-28 21:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

As of May 24, there is a comment in the fasteners library indicating that the write_lock context manager will guarantee fairness:

https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/commit/de15d5efb0a5603b2437e4784ca1039cd73b5dbc'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-05-29 16:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yup comment added, I can do a release of that library if that helps :)

Just let me know.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-05-29 19:52:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Yup comment added, I can do a release of that library if that helps
 > :)
 > 
 > Just let me know.

I'm not too concerned about that.  I just wanted to make sure this was a documented feature and not an internal implementation detail we were relying on.

We do still need unit tests for this new code though."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-05-30 00:36:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Okies: https://fasteners.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/lock.html#fasteners.lock.ReaderWriterLock.write_lock updated, and that must be true! because that's how docs work, lol"}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-06 00:54:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-07 18:50:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-16 15:57:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Thanks! This looks good, there's just one more problematic case that I think we should handle. Details inline.

Otherwise I think this is ready to go."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-16 17:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-16 21:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-16 23:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-16 23:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Something like this?  Or were you thinking of some other docs?'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-17 17:11:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I was actually thinking just in the docstring, but having full documentation for this feature is good, so this works for me.

We do still need a release note for it though.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-17 23:34:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-18 16:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-18 16:06:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-18 20:10:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

Hmm, one of the new tests failed: http://logs.openstack.org/73/473973/6/check/openstack-tox-py27/d517bba/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-10-18_18_19_57_810134

Doesn't seem like that should be able to happen."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-18 22:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Theoretically there is a race because we release the threading.Lock before trying to get the fair lock.  If we blocked for whatever reason in one thread it might be possible for the next thread to try to get the fair lock out-of-order.

I think I can make it race-free, but at the cost of requiring some knowledge of fasteners internals.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-18 22:30:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-24 21:30:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

The only other option I can think of (which is not appreciably less hacky, but doesn't rely on private members) is to sleep after creating each lock to "ensure" it happens before the next one. I did something like that in https://github.com/openstack/oslo.concurrency/blob/master/oslo_concurrency/tests/unit/test_lockutils.py#L416 and as far as I know it hasn't caused any problems.

If we did that we'd probably want to test fewer than 100 locks so we don't have to wait so long, but that would probably be okay. Over time we would see failures if there was an actual bug.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-25 20:27:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-26 15:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-26 15:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Silly editor added hard tabs.  Fixed.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-30 16:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-01 21:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

This looks correct based on the irc converstation we also had but
i did not know that the readerwriterlock was internally queue untill
you told me on irc and it would be nice to capture that in the code.

but that is a nit so still +1'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-01 21:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-02 13:41:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

The logic looks OK. We can probably do some work to create a single container type that's reusable, but that can come in a separate patch. For now, I think it's important to address Sean's comments."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-11-02 16:40:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-11-02 16:55:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)

updated per comments'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-11-05 21:11:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-05 21:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add support for fair locks

This adds support for a "fair" variant of the lock.  When there are
multiple entities within a single process that are blocked waiting
for the lock the fair lock will ensure that they acquire the lock
in FIFO order.

For now at least, when fair locks are in use we don't support
the "semaphores" argument.

If external locks are enabled, the inter-process ordering will be
determined by the underlying OS lock ordering and process scheduling.

Change-Id: I37577becff4978bf643c65fa9bc2d78d342ea35a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-05 09:10:41.000000000', 'message': 'Document "insecure" flag

I received a clouds.yaml with "insecure: True" which I had not seen
before.

There's no explicit mention of this in the documentation, but due to a
name clash in the example in the reference it initially led me to
believe it was a section of the config file.  So firstly make the
cloud names more verbose to illustrate what's going on, and add a
mention of the "insecure" flag, but suggest using "verify".

Similarly in the unit tests use more explicit cloud names to make it
obvious what's going on.  Add a test that ensures "insecure=True"
implies "verify=False".

I received a clouds.yaml with "insecure: True" which I had not seen

There's no explicit mention of this in the documentation, but due to a
name clash in the example in the reference it initially led me to

cloud names more verbose to illustrate what's going on, and add a
mention of the "insecure" flag, but suggest using "verify".

implies "verify=False".

commit_message:
Document "insecure" flag

I received a clouds.yaml with "insecure: True" which I had not seen
before.

There's no explicit mention of this in the documentation, but due to a
name clash in the example in the reference it initially led me to
believe it was a section of the config file.  So firstly make the
cloud names more verbose to illustrate what's going on, and add a
mention of the "insecure" flag, but suggest using "verify".

Similarly in the unit tests use more explicit cloud names to make it
obvious what's going on.  Add a test that ensures "insecure=True"
implies "verify=False".

Change-Id: I56fe7460431442ad4ca264e32d2494068cf7f05e

commit_message:
Force translation of table header

Concatenation of lazily translated strings using + is not supported,
but prettytable is doing that internally with one of the translated
strings that we pass in. Use six.text_type to force immediate
translation of the string before passing it to prettytable.

Change-Id: I73929f9df85a9856bb70b37ee08f5399f98fdb00
Closes-Bug: 1801761

[{'created': '2018-11-05 12:09:16.000000000', 'message': "tests: Add glance_api group to test package installation

The role does not install any packages unless a suitable group is found
in the inventory. As such, add a dummy 'glace_api' group to make sure
that the functional tests actually install the Ceph packages.

Change-Id: I8155bf199a99912527a50b98dfe916b8b2d9b23e
"}, {'created': '2018-11-05 13:24:20.000000000', 'message': "tests: Add nova_compute group to test package installation

The role does not install any packages unless a suitable group is found
in the inventory. As such, add a dummy 'nova_compute' group to make sure
that the functional tests actually install the Ceph packages.

Change-Id: I8155bf199a99912527a50b98dfe916b8b2d9b23e
"}, {'created': '2018-11-05 13:53:59.000000000', 'message': 'tests: Skip role if ceph_mons list is empty

The role execution only makes sense if we are configuring a node as a
Ceph monitor so we can skip all the task inclusions if this list is
empty.

Change-Id: I8155bf199a99912527a50b98dfe916b8b2d9b23e
'}]
commit_message:
tests: Skip role if ceph_mons list is empty

The role execution only makes sense if we are configuring a node as a
Ceph monitor so we can skip all the task inclusions if this list is
empty.

Change-Id: I8155bf199a99912527a50b98dfe916b8b2d9b23e

commit_message:
pbr: Remove unused translation sections from setup.cfg

Patrole doesn't have a translation infrastructure, so this is
to remove translation sections from the setup.cfg; these
sections are the same as those documented under:

https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#python-projects

Change-Id: If2efd6e462933d0d192e331d12f0798ddf12ce46

commit_message:
notification: Add 'status' to agent after_create/update

Make the same status information available to notification consumers
(resource==agent, event==after_create/after_update) as it was already
available where the notification is sent in class AgentDbMixin.

Change-Id: Ie74091da934c7e49fd29ae4c6f930a7eb47e14b2
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Use python3 for doc building

Update requirements and code for python3, this will not work with
python2 anymore.

Also, update to openstackdocstheme as current OpenStack theme and
configure it.

Some noteworthy changes:
* Remove reload, setting of UTF-8 in vmt.py - this is not needed anymore
  with python3.
* Update requirements of Sphinx to current versions
* The Markup construct does not work with python3 in conf.py, replace
  with simpler string.
* No need to use "pip -U", remove -U option.
* in vmt.py: Strings are unicode in python3, no need to check for it.

Change-Id: I421e3d4a09ff19523b3bd0ca015e31a4bd1e0608

commit_message:
Add container images for openshift 3.11

This adds the necessary images and tag they appropriately for the
related OpenShift services they will be used by.

origin and node images are not updated anymore on the dockerhub
starting from 3.11 and are replaced by origin-control-plane and
origin-node. As a result, openshift_base_image var was renamed
openshift_prefix, and DockerOpenShiftBaseImage heat param was renamed
DockerOpenShiftControlPlaneImage.

The coreos images are normally hosted on quay.io but were copied over
to the dockerhub to workaround bug #1799396.

Change-Id: Ibbd5ff9d3597f5add440b92a27a2f2f669f7bdbe

commit_message:
trivial: Correct base class name in hacking check

This patch set fixes the base class name in a hacking check
unit test for PluginRbacTest Suffix (P104).

The passing case should be:

  class FakePluginRbacTest(base.BaseFakePluginRbacTest)

Not:

  class FakePluginRbacTest(base.BaseFakeRbacTest)

Because the point is to check that all subclasses that inherit
from class .+PluginRbacTest also end in that suffix.

Change-Id: Ic6306b97bb68c42f51e796d876893f9ac91c67a4

commit_message:
Release python-freezerclient 2.0.0

This is the Stein milestone-1 release for python-freezerclient to
release merged commits since the last release.

See [1] for more details on the new cycle-with-intermediary library
release changes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135689.html

We plan on processing this release November 1 unless we are told to hold
off, or earlier if we get a +1 from the PTL and/or release liaison
indicating that it is all clear to proceed.

Change-Id: I6f6a5e532cf94cf7bc0ed031bacb7b64149913a4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-11-01 21:43:35.000000000', 'message': 'Use pyyaml to output group vars

Because the ansible group vars can be more complex structures than
strings and ints, we should use yaml to output the groupvars files. This
will allow list or dict values to be correctly represented in the
ansible vars files.

Change-Id: I79b3e6a5e7acb5f95d65034a2908a005d9a343db
Closes-Bug: #1801162
'}]
commit_message:
Use pyyaml to output group vars

Because the ansible group vars can be more complex structures than
strings and ints, we should use yaml to output the groupvars files. This
will allow list or dict values to be correctly represented in the
ansible vars files.

Change-Id: I79b3e6a5e7acb5f95d65034a2908a005d9a343db
Closes-Bug: #1801162

commit_message:
Add network availability zones client

This patch creates the network v2.0 available zones client.
This client has only one api calls
- List available zones
This patch also includes tests for the new ip available client.

Change-Id: I881e3e038a775bd826b5c5675cb95e949f9c717e

commit_message:
Update static.o.o publishing

We can now use the 'tox -e docs' publishing for all repos, update the
remaining static publishing docs.

Change use of publish-static to new defined job publish-tox-docs-static,
we can remove publish-static once all users are updated but need both
jobs for now for the transition.

Update governance-website and transparent-policy to use new docs-pti
job, the tox.ini files for these repos handle "tox -e docs".

Change-Id: I5cba38e1a2a6c01e692a542efad6b4df77cd0751
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/615498
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/615497

commit_message:
Move docs requirements to doc file

reno and sphinx requirements are only needed in doc/requirements,
not in the main file. Move them.

Change-Id: Ia47d2e1564c5ab58ec03acb65c4587693940ccf4

commit_message:
Support v1 container image manifests

This is needed to support inspecting images served by quay.io.
Apparently this old manifest version is the only one supported by
quay.io.

This is required for tripleo-openshift, as some images are hosted on
quay.io.

Change-Id: I4c64848c7eb21cd4370c9be72cea842863513c01
Closes-Bug: #1799396

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-14 20:07:04.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve get_build_command output before container_build_id

In releases Rocky and later, the get_build_command is not used
directly as a bash variable and therefore needs to be
evaluated before it is assigned to container_build_id.

Change-Id: Ia801fa7326c3e5c64a8a5f5999a03ab758451122
'}, {'created': '2018-09-14 20:46:46.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve get_build_command output before container_build_id

In releases Rocky and later, the get_build_command is not used
directly as a bash variable and therefore needs to be

commit_message:
Resolve get_build_command output before container_build_id

In releases Rocky and later, the get_build_command is not used
directly as a bash variable and therefore needs to be
evaluated before it is assigned to container_build_id.

This review also adds an option to supply
docker_insecure_registries to the undercloud.conf.

Change-Id: Ia801fa7326c3e5c64a8a5f5999a03ab758451122

commit_message:
Change user details view in a tab view

Change the existing user details view into a tabbed view with
currently just one tab (overview tab) which presents general
informations of the user.

This is done to be able to add other tabs to the user details
view.

Change-Id: I38a33a3b218caf5d76eabd513e22aa118cc26ea1
Partial-Bug: #1792524

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 17:02:16.000000000', 'message': "Recreate cinder LVM loopback device on startup

Add a systemd service that creates the loopback device required by
cinder's iSCSI backend on system startup.

This patch also consolidates the host_prep_tasks for the HA and non-HA
versions of the cinder-volume service. The list of tasks is identical,
and rather than repeating it in each template, the tasks are defined
once in cinder-common.yaml.

NOTE: This backport does not set the 'setype' when creating cinder's
persistent directories. Setting the 'setype' is required only in later
releases.

Closes-Bug: #1581092
Change-Id: Icc04003a9e90b66720d968c6c8f1c687156b677e
(cherry picked from commit 2040d4f284b1507abb8fb4013ea5a162a9cf96e2)
(cherry picked from commit 5ef1ade75347da10ec09005d7b74a23474acc861)
"}]
commit_message:
Recreate cinder LVM loopback device on startup

Add a systemd service that creates the loopback device required by
cinder's iSCSI backend on system startup.

This patch also consolidates the host_prep_tasks for the HA and non-HA
versions of the cinder-volume service. The list of tasks is identical,
and rather than repeating it in each template, the tasks are defined
once in cinder-common.yaml.

NOTE: This backport does not set the 'setype' when creating cinder's
persistent directories. Setting the 'setype' is required only in later
releases.

Closes-Bug: #1581092
Change-Id: Icc04003a9e90b66720d968c6c8f1c687156b677e
(cherry picked from commit 2040d4f284b1507abb8fb4013ea5a162a9cf96e2)
(cherry picked from commit 5ef1ade75347da10ec09005d7b74a23474acc861)

Closes-Bug: #1800754

subject: Handle deprecated cinder iSCSI parameters
messages:
[{'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-10-31 15:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-11-01 14:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-11-01 22:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-11-02 05:42:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

can u also check tht changes: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/services/cinder-backend-dellsc.yaml#L114-L115'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-11-02 11:46:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> can u also check tht changes: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/services/cinder-backend-dellsc.yaml#L114-L115

It's true the hiera data set by the THT is using the deprecated names, and it's here in puppet-tripleo the correct parameters are used when creating the puppet-cinder resource. Fully cleaning the names up would involve several steps:

1. Update tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::dellsc to support both names using something like pick().

2. Update THT to use the correct names

3. Update puppet-tripleo to remove support for the deprecated names.

I suppose we could eliminate step 1 by ensuring the puppet-tripleo and tht patches (steps 2 and 3) merged close together. It won't affect CI because the Dell SC backend isn't used in CI, but there's still a window between the time the two patches merge when things will be broken for anyone using this backend.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-11-02 12:12:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-11-05 12:53:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

don't we want to add a deprecation warning for those iscsi_* now configure target_* things and will be removed shortly?"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-11-05 12:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

an example https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606095/25/manifests/profile/base/neutron/ovn_metadata_agent_wrappers.pp@50

please also add a release note, an example https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606095/25/releasenotes/notes/wrapper-containers-debug-f141d964548eb2ea.yaml@14'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-11-05 15:24:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> don't we want to add a deprecation warning for those iscsi_* now
 > configure target_* things and will be removed shortly?

Cinder deprecated the iscsi_* names in order to consolidate some naming
conventions, and this forced puppet-cinder to adapt. That patch [1] does
include a deprecation release note and warnings.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/614536

This patch simply updates puppet-tripleo to use the new puppet-cinder
parameters names so it doesn't trigger any of the puppet-cinder warnings. My
intention is to not change the interface between THT and puppet, and certainly
not change any THT parameter names. See also the comment I posted just prior to
when I uploaded PS4. In short, I'd rather not propagate the name changes any
further because I don't think it adds value."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-05 16:02:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-11-05 16:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-11-05 16:03:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Handle deprecated cinder iSCSI parameters

Cinder removed support for some previously deprecated configs, which
in turn required an update to puppet-cinder. This patch fixes the
parameter names used when creating puppet-cinder resources to not use
the deprecated names.

Closes-Bug: #1801081
Depends-On: I355298aaa7e48d242ad05b8c931ee9d41339185f
Change-Id: Ice4992678902a5adc090323fb232c8405e747bb5

As discussed in IRC today:

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2018-07-23.log.html#t2018-07-23T13:32:22-2

I think we should do the service list/show partial results in the same microversion as the server (instance) list/show partial results, otherwise it's kind of weird to have multiple microversions for getting partial results at different parts of the API. [{'created': '2018-07-23 11:54:40.000000000', 'message': 'Return a minimal construct for nova service-list when a cell is down

This patch modifies the existing behavior of nova service-list which
ignores a down cell to returning a partial construct consisting of
the binary and host info obtained from the API host_mappings table
for the compute services in the down cells by introducing a new API
microversion. This way when the admin gets partial results for certain
records, he/she will know that that particular cell is unreachable.

Related to blueprint bp/handling-down-cell

commit_message:
Minimal construct plumbing for nova service-list when a cell is down

This patch modifies the existing behavior of nova service-list which
ignores a down cell to returning a partial construct consisting of
the binary and host info obtained from the API host_mappings table
for the compute services in the down cells. This is enabled by passing
a new enough microversion, which is added in a later patch in this
series.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: I9cf5e4eb7f70c495001fd064c060d7d5b3dd5bff

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-21 19:52:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tasks in check mode

These tasks should have check_mode:no set so that they run in check
mode, as the variables they register are used in later tasks. Otherwise,
ansible in check mode fails with undefined variable errors.

Change-Id: I84bc3c14ede37959a4078fd14ce4661b7bd23f84
'}, {'created': '2018-09-21 21:37:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tasks in check mode

These tasks should have check_mode:no set so that they run in check
mode, as the variables they register are used in later tasks. Otherwise,
ansible in check mode fails with undefined variable errors.

Change-Id: I84bc3c14ede37959a4078fd14ce4661b7bd23f84

commit_message:
Fix tasks in check mode

These tasks should have check_mode:no set so that they run in check
mode, as the variables they register are used in later tasks. Otherwise,
ansible in check mode fails with undefined variable errors.

Also, some tasks may fail due to not all requirements being available
since those requirements were not created by previous tasks that were
also ran in check mode.

This adds ignore_errors to these tasks, and sets the value to the
boolean ansible_check_mode which is provided by ansible and set based on
whether or not --check was passed to the ansible command line.

Change-Id: I84bc3c14ede37959a4078fd14ce4661b7bd23f84

[{'created': '2018-11-05 15:13:24.000000000', 'message': 'Documentation Fix - auth_url Port Number

Made a small fix to the documentation - replacing
the current auth_url port number 35357, in the
configuration section of the [keystone_authtoken],
with 5000.

This was based on an online conversation with Colleen;
with the removal of the v2 API from keystone the project
now recommends use of port 5000 instead of the previous one.

Change-Id: I750a4d0e75e0b919fd00ddf21c0e7ce62d495f95
'}]
commit_message:
Documentation Fix - auth_url Port Number

Made a small fix to the documentation - replacing
the current auth_url port number 35357, in the
configuration section of the [keystone_authtoken],
with 5000.

This was based on an online conversation with Colleen;
with the removal of the v2 API from keystone the project
now recommends use of port 5000 instead of the previous one.

Change-Id: I750a4d0e75e0b919fd00ddf21c0e7ce62d495f95

Agreeing with Felipe, needs reno for this.'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-09-16 15:55:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I believe this bug is a result of misunderstanding in nova's config, just because the filter is available does not mean the filter is enabled. I believe Nova keeps these options separate for a reason[1][2] or is it true that tempest is trying to operate on the assumption that if a filter is available it is also enabled?

I think this change helps update the config to be closer to the correct solution because scheduler_available_filters absolutely should explicitly list the available filters but I still think there is config option missing for the enabled filters in nova. 

I believe a change should be made in tempest so there are two options:

1. scheduler_enabled_filters, defaults to ['all']

2. scheduler_available_filters, defaults to nova's default available filters.

and is_scheduler_filter_enabled method should return True or False based on the condition:

    * filter in scheduler_available_filters and ('all' in scheduler_enabled_filters or filter in scheduler_enabled_filters))

Does that make sense? or maybe I just missed something..

I'm not sure if I should block the change for these reasons though, so I'll just leave it as a +0 for now to see if it stirs up any discussion.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/conf/scheduler.py#n282
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/conf/scheduler.py#n307
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/common/compute.py#n58"}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-09-16 16:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-09-16 16:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Putting aside the meaning of 'available' and 'enabled' for a moment (for the record, I think tempest's 'available' means the same as nova's 'enabled - a filter in nova is "enabled", a filter in a cloud is "available" for use by tempest in its tests), I think I've finally figured out why we've had all this trouble.

The problem isn't the 'all' value per se, it's that it's the *default*, so we end up with a situation where the tempest and nova defaults don't match. *That's* the cause of the problem. So I've just proposed a new version that just changes the default value, leaving 'all' as an available value to keep backwards compatibility.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-09-16 16:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-09-16 18:56:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> I believe this bug is a result of misunderstanding in nova's

 > 
 > Does that make sense? or maybe I just missed something..
 > 
 > I'm not sure if I should block the change for these reasons though,
 > so I'll just leave it as a +0 for now to see if it stirs up any
 > discussion.
 > 
 > [1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/conf/scheduler.py#n282
 > [2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/conf/scheduler.py#n307
 > [3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/common/compute.py#n58

yes, this is actual problem. we have mixed the both config option when doing in tempest.That was mistake and i do not know when i forgot to fix this after finding this issue in denver PTG, 2017 :(."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-09 10:21:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

as background for this issue, we added this config option and did the mistake to name it to 'scheduler_available_filters' and soe deos defaulted this to nova.CONF.scheduler.available_filters default value which is 'all' filter available in nova as default. 

Instead Tempest should have config option corresponding to nova.CONF.scheduler.enabled_filters which actually tell thats these are the filters present in your cloud you are testing. And default value of that config option must be what nova.CONF.scheduler.enabled_filters has which is not 'all'.

I have found this issue in denver PTG, 2017 and forgot to fix this after that. Thanks for fixing and bringing this.  

IMO, we should go with below approach: 

1. Introduce new config options ''scheduler_enabled_filters'', defaults to nova.CONF.scheduler.enabled_filters defaults.

2. deprecate the current config option - ''scheduler_available_filters'' in favor of new option ''scheduler_enabled_filters''. (or you can say rename the existing config option but need to support both name)This will maintain the backward compatibility. 

3. start using the new config option in is_scheduler_filter_enabled() method.

4. remove the ''scheduler_available_filters'' in T.

This way we can maintain the backward compatibility also and provide the new config options with correct defaults."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-10-17 18:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-10-17 18:16:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Good plan GMann, done!'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-10-17 18:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-18 16:42:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

also add reno for this new config options and deprecating the old one.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-10-19 15:53:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-23 14:26:24.000000000', 'message': "Give scheduler_available_filters sensible default

scheduler_available_filters had a special 'all' value that was
understood to mean 'all filters are enabled' by various tempest tests.
However, what it really meant is 'the default nova filters are
enabled.' Because this is confusing and problematic, this patch
completely replaces the 'all' default with a new value taken from
the default list of enabled filters in nova.conf.

Change-Id: I5c87865dc650d383ee006d36b6d52cdd90577ab9
Related-bug: 1628443
"}, {'created': '2018-07-16 20:04:41.000000000', 'message': "Give scheduler_available_filters sensible default

scheduler_available_filters had a special 'all' value that was
understood to mean 'all filters are enabled' by various tempest tests.
However, what it really meant is 'the default nova filters are
enabled.' Because this is confusing and problematic, this patch

filters, even if those filters weren't enabled in Nova. This patch

commit_message:
Deprecate available filters in favor of enabled

Previously, Tempest's default for scheduler_available_filters was
'all'. This was different from Nova's default enabled_filters, which
does *not* include all possible filters available in Nova. Thus, in a
deployment where both options were kept at their default value,
Tempest's is_scheduler_filter_enabled() would return True for all
filters, even if those filters weren't enabled in Nova. In addition,
the 'available' wording could be made clearer. This patch deprecates
scheduler_available_filters, replacing it with
scheduler_enabled_filters. The latter has its default value set to
Nova's enabled_filters default.

Related-bug: 1628443
Change-Id: I5c87865dc650d383ee006d36b6d52cdd90577ab9

commit_message:
Remove inclusion of legacy playbook in tripleo-ci-base

Legacy zuul-cloner and subnode definitions
should no longer be required in zuul v3
work. subnodes should be picked up via the
inventory.

This review includes a mock-etc-nodepool playbook
only for use when repos outside CI reference
/etc/nodepool/* files. All references in CI code
should be removed.

Depends-On: I902ce149e72b616e5e18facc17e4371aafcd373a
Depends-On: I335f0bba2ca9c3e7e427e9247692c5c0d17b4087
Depends-On: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/16013/
Closes-Bug: #1785799
Change-Id: I53fca2541ca0f49fb1c2636d01044dd3e3aa0f0d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-01 20:00:50.000000000', 'message': 'Scan for MAC through all devices in macvtap agent

The first device the agent happens to pick could be something
without a MAC address like a 6in6 interface. This was causing
the agent to fail to start if it was unlucky enough to pick
that address.

This patch just adjusts the logic to keep iterating through
the list until we find a MAC.

Change-Id: Iba9c7c3cb200e74a78ea885e8d9323de64c2c663
Closes-Bug: #1801030
'}]
commit_message:
Scan for MAC through all devices in macvtap agent

The first device the agent happens to pick could be something
without a MAC address like a 6in6 interface. This was causing
the agent to fail to start if it was unlucky enough to pick
that address.

This patch just adjusts the logic to keep iterating through
the list until we find a MAC.

Change-Id: Iba9c7c3cb200e74a78ea885e8d9323de64c2c663
Closes-Bug: #1801030

commit_message:
by default collect all files in /var/lib/mistral

Playbooks, roles and logs for the overcloud deployment
now are in /var/lib/mistral.  These files should be
captured by default.

Change-Id: I00f7de1d1f6a4ac1c8785b92c6edef10c95bc6cd

commit_message:
Add integration with osprofiler in devstack plugin

This patch adds integration of rally with osprofiler when
rally is deployed with devstack.
It may help to use rally with osprofiler e.g. in OpenStack
gate jobs.

Change-Id: Ie34c060cfab67a13dca8cfd3706e8a2ed40dbe99

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:49:54.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I39cf393447186adb19699abc3506c770baa85543
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I39cf393447186adb19699abc3506c770baa85543
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-16 19:46:17.000000000', 'message': 'Update sphinx extension logging

Sphinx 1.6 deprecated using the application object to perform logging
and it will be removed in the upcoming 2.0 release. This updates our
extensions to use the recommended sphinx.util.logging instead.

Change-Id: I364d8837283be0164624b4ffc4a48352661c697d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update sphinx extension logging

Sphinx 1.6 deprecated using the application object to perform logging
and it will be removed in the upcoming 2.0 release. This updates our
extensions to use the recommended sphinx.util.logging instead.

Change-Id: I364d8837283be0164624b4ffc4a48352661c697d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
switch documentation job to new PTI

Update .zuul.yaml to use PTI job, update tox.ini to use the common way
to run sphinx, update setup.cfg for handling warnings as errors.

Add new docs target to tox.ini and make it default target, the target is
needed by CI scripts.

Note that ossa does not work with python3, so the docs environment does
not use basepython. This needs a rework of doc/source/_exts/vmt.py.

Change-Id: I7196aab97167d857f0afdfe005d74c7f0f8f1073

The test GetOvercloudConfigActionTest.test_run failed because the key

commit_message:
[Core] Fix the KeyError exception.

The test GetOvercloudConfigActionTest.test_run failed because the key
last_modified was not present in the structure. I have modified the test
to fix it. But I have also modified the download_container method to
check if the key exist before to get it.

Change-Id: Ia8038d8020eb4de02d151a2f7bfc69463621bb8d

[{'created': '2018-09-17 10:32:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Swift storage device setup

The formerly extra puppet parameter "base_dir" has been ignored when
switching to a containerized overcloud, which broke support for
non-default device path - for example when using multipath devices.

Closes-Bug: 1777116
Change-Id: If60479998a9f02393c0d49d1b752b9ef4f8f9aff
(cherry picked from commit e0ec6f5b75f0662b7c0241a9a12dc3743ceec8cf)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Swift storage device setup

The formerly extra puppet parameter "base_dir" has been ignored when
switching to a containerized overcloud, which broke support for
non-default device path - for example when using multipath devices.

Closes-Bug: 1777116
Change-Id: If60479998a9f02393c0d49d1b752b9ef4f8f9aff
(cherry picked from commit e0ec6f5b75f0662b7c0241a9a12dc3743ceec8cf)

3) Third patch to openstack-infra/project-config to request adding the os_blazar repo base jobs

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-27 14:49:14.000000000', 'message': "tox: Stop building *all* docs in 'docs'

The 'docs' target currently builds the documentation trees in 'api-ref'
and 'api-guide', in addition to 'doc'. This massively increases the
amount of time docs take to build both locally and in the gate. It's
not necessary for gate, since separate jobs take care of the other
documents for barbican.  As such, we should stop doing it.

For users that *do* care about this (for whatever reason) a new
'all-docs' target is included.

Change-Id: I3aa314f8643fcb4da93f8642034edddc2145bc32
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Stop building *all* docs in 'docs'

The 'docs' target currently builds the documentation trees in 'api-ref'
and 'api-guide', in addition to 'doc'. This massively increases the
amount of time docs take to build both locally and in the gate. It's
not necessary for gate, since separate jobs take care of the other
documents for barbican.  As such, we should stop doing it.

For users that *do* care about this (for whatever reason) a new
'all-docs' target is included.

Change-Id: I3aa314f8643fcb4da93f8642034edddc2145bc32

commit_message:
Enable undercloud_enable_tempest to true for minimal

* Since tempest is runned using tempest container so
  undercloud_enable_tempest is set to be true so that it will enable
  tempest in undercloud.conf and pull tempest container on undercloud
  registry and reuse it from there while running it.

Change-Id: Ibe7e873f204679f25c09ea51b3818f7eed3b53e5
Closes-Bug: #1800682

commit_message:
Disable MistralDockerGroup creation with podman

I'm testing podman without docker/docker registry
installed and it failed. This resolves issues with
the Mistral puppet execution so that it ignores
the docker group creation.

Change-Id: I1deb31dce021796f3ea98f1c1030c362108397bb

commit_message:
Parametrize OpenShift deployment type

This prevents hardcoding it in the template and allows to check for the
right service name during new node detection as origin and
openshift-enterprise deployment types use differnt prefixes for the
services.

Change-Id: Id5cf7d6f7888b759eec7c969275fe15779b7b775
(cherry picked from commit 6ebaeb5c85a990e88f5425159afa570368d1779d)

Export container_cli for update & upgrades & post upgrade tasks

container_cli will be used later by update, upgrade and post upgrade tasks.
This patch is separated from actual tasks, so we can quickly iterate in
multiple patches.

Change-Id: I1ed7dec0019113f1259bce986f354723237f6a25

commit_message:
Add posibilities to set default timeouts for octavia

Expose timeouts values for octavia frontend client
and backend member by parameters:
* OctaviaTimeoutClientData
* OctaviaTimeoutMemberConnect
* OctaviaTimeoutMemberData
* OctaviaTimeoutTcpInspect

Change-Id: I07afa4e15c595f984cba23672f910993495851ff
Closes-Bug: 1797130
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/609420/

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-05 09:59:14.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly set containerized_undercloud in the UC cont. upgrade job

In change Iff509f4dc09862a451ad5cf915aa7764a314c28c we plan to
introduce smart defaulting, e.g. containerized_undercloud will take a
release-aware default value instead of always defaulting to false.

However, this change seems to break featureset050 because it changes
the containerized_undercloud value in it from false to true. Set it to
false explicitly in fs050 so that we keep the original state here and
unblock the smart defaults patch.

Change-Id: Ia54eb8988225d0b45787ab89948d2c610c27257a
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set containerized_undercloud in the UC cont. upgrade job

In change Iff509f4dc09862a451ad5cf915aa7764a314c28c we plan to
introduce smart defaulting, e.g. containerized_undercloud will take a
release-aware default value instead of always defaulting to false.

However, this change seems to break featureset050 because it changes
the containerized_undercloud value in it from false to true. Set it to
false explicitly in fs050 so that we keep the original state here and
unblock the smart defaults patch.

Change-Id: Ia54eb8988225d0b45787ab89948d2c610c27257a

commit_message:
Fix novajoin nova vendordata hieradata keys

A recent commit [1] deprecated the parameters we were using for
configuring nova-metadata, so we need to use these new parameters.

[1] Ic65736cb0e95c400a728cd699ecf06c6aecff832

Closes-Bug: #1799352

Depends-on: Ic3654c79d8cf275f0c58d57a4b66e2598450a7ed
Change-Id: I62438ca4feea583c005bad537746713fc835073d
(cherry picked from commit ff93536a6624dd6c7d3a5b893d503431007c5d35)

commit_message:
Drop deprecated Telemetry services from custom roles_data.

Next services were removed in Queens:
  - OS::TripleO::Services::CeilometerApi
  - OS::TripleO::Services::CeilometerCollector
  - OS::TripleO::Services::CeilometerExpirer
and have to be removed from custom roles_data.yaml file.

Change-Id: Ic0e203fae34de816845f7f965aaf3584900ea20a
(cherry picked from commit 037919f92eaf06d30bf351502a226ab2b50845a2)

te-broker.

commit_message:
Use ansible_pkg_mgr at role install-build-repo

For for fedora28 we need it to use dnf instead of yum.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/319?kanban-status=1447275

Change-Id: I3b5f533857e3bf67c9ddf8fa2b6e82757b335ae8

the case, then take that information rather than the default. This is to
allow this test to run in the dragonflow gate with the proposed patch.

commit_message:
Take dragonflow repo and branch from ZUUL env

When set-up with ZUUL, ZUUL provides a git repo and branch. If that's
the case, then take that information rather than the default. This is to
allow this test to run in the dragonflow gate with the proposed patch.

Change-Id: I1a1df6a1ef6289907281f53dbceb99ee5254075e

[{'created': '2018-10-31 15:36:50.000000000', 'message': "mariadb: make security_reset.expect's timeout configurable

Under heavy load, when the security_reset script is being run to set
up root password, it might happen that the mysql server doesn't get a
change to evaluate the SQL statement sent by security_reset.expect
before the hardcoded 10 seconds timeout is reached.

Allow the timeout to be overriden via env variable DB_MAX_TIMEOUT,
which is already used as a timeout variable in extend_start.sh

Change-Id: If82c6daca82a48d899605829dc99cf4a352cddcd
Closes-Bug: #1775864
(cherry picked from commit 8e2906a59e663d43aaac2369b5b74e5142b61d53)
"}]
commit_message:
mariadb: make security_reset.expect's timeout configurable

Under heavy load, when the security_reset script is being run to set
up root password, it might happen that the mysql server doesn't get a
change to evaluate the SQL statement sent by security_reset.expect
before the hardcoded 10 seconds timeout is reached.

Allow the timeout to be overriden via env variable DB_MAX_TIMEOUT,
which is already used as a timeout variable in extend_start.sh

Change-Id: If82c6daca82a48d899605829dc99cf4a352cddcd
Closes-Bug: #1775864
(cherry picked from commit 8e2906a59e663d43aaac2369b5b74e5142b61d53)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-04 18:43:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix developer config dir flask aftermath

Before flask, the code that checked for a local developer environment
config file lived in keystone/server/wsgi.py, and checked for configs at
../../.. relative to itself. Now it lives in
keystone/server/flask/core.py but still checks the same directory depth,
leaving it one short. This patch adds another directory level to the
possible_topdir path so that the wsgi application will correctly look in
keystone/etc instead of keystone/keystone/etc.

Change-Id: If1c8d7c9bb1ea7d2642ab5c5e7f92adec33bf1f2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix developer config dir flask aftermath

Before flask, the code that checked for a local developer environment
config file lived in keystone/server/wsgi.py, and checked for configs at
../../.. relative to itself. Now it lives in
keystone/server/flask/core.py but still checks the same directory depth,
leaving it one short. This patch adds another directory level to the
possible_topdir path so that the wsgi application will correctly look in
keystone/etc instead of keystone/keystone/etc.

Change-Id: If1c8d7c9bb1ea7d2642ab5c5e7f92adec33bf1f2

commit_message:
Add StarlingX core groups

The StarlingX project has been operated with on core group, but formed
sub-project teams since. This patch adds the groups for each
sub-project to reflect this change.

Change-Id: I5a9c01c4f79bbe62c93fc77d1ac09304a08ff3a6

commit_message:
Set containerized_undercloud_upgrade to true

Q to R upgrade is focused on upgrading to containerzied undercloud,
so it worth to make it as default.
If non-containerized upgrade is required aforementioned option
has to be set to false '-e -containerized_undercloud_upgrade=false'

Change-Id: Ieddfe3670b047c0e27b7388373da9aee44a5c2e1

commit_message:
Fix issues with nova distro install on Ubuntu

The Ubuntu nova-api and nova-spiceproxy distro packages create services
with names differing from the OSA's defaults. Set default init overrides
for these services which provide these names as aliases.

The nova-compute-kvm package creates a nova-compute.conf file setting
libvirt.virt_type=kvm which overrides anything in nova.conf. Remove it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614888
Change-Id: I0bf038930fde4790bcc8f9dbbacd236901c94346

commit_message:
Fix an issue with double fernet key rotation

When the token and receipt directories don't match perfectly
(e.g. trailing slash vs not), we would get double key rotation.

Use os.path to make sure we are indeed checking for the same path.

Change-Id: I34c5e4891773bcd6a799f3dbfa7174718030c4e4

New repositories were added into the openstack-helm umbrella,

commit_message:
Add notifications to openstack-helm

New repositories were added into the openstack-helm umbrella,
namely openstack-helm-docs and openstack-helm-images.

This simplifies the gerritbot rules to receive notifications from
everything openstack-helm.* related, instead of listing the
repositories, one by one.

Change-Id: Ie12118498a94775032824cc4870e64efa38ab603

commit_message:
Prevent appending \n in Sonobuoy's secret-etc

It's presumed that some versions of Kubernetes do not handle this,
which is why the experimental job is still working.

Change-Id: If3a712cca278e02908cf9be8dfefa75a782bac09

commit_message:
Use marker to skip completed plays

Rerun leapfrog always rerun setup-hosts and infrastructure plays, which
cost a lot time and unnecessary if they succeeded already. Using marker
file to decide if plays conclude.

Change-Id: Ifb4215b8981144bfaaf470d0a32c38b423c1f891

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 21:44:43.000000000', 'message': "Restart cinder-scheduler instead of reloading

During upgrade testing, I consistently notice
that the cinder-scheduler is running at 100% CPU and
appears to be in a hung state after the upgrade.

Restarting the process clears this up so this commit
changes the cinder-scheduler to a restart instead of
a reload.  This appears to have been an issue
previously but I've only seen the scheduler process
spinning at 100%.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1709346

Change-Id: Ia0bf98413567267865be0503b08d5a03a9698214
"}]
commit_message:
Restart cinder-scheduler instead of reloading

During upgrade testing, I consistently notice
that the cinder-scheduler is running at 100% CPU and
appears to be in a hung state after the upgrade.

Restarting the process clears this up so this commit
changes the cinder-scheduler to a restart instead of
a reload.  This appears to have been an issue
previously but I've only seen the scheduler process
spinning at 100%.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1709346

Change-Id: Ia0bf98413567267865be0503b08d5a03a9698214

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 04:11:53.000000000', 'message': "Pin argparse for idempotent pip installs

Argparse is part of the Python standard library in 2.7 but is still
an unmarked and unpinned downstream dependency of some packages
(unittest2==1.1.0 for example).

Ubuntu's libpython2.7-stdlib package includes an argparse.egg-info file
setting its version to 1.2.1.

The python_venv_build process will try to build and install the latest
version of argparse available in PyPI, 1.4.0, but this will never
actually install over the existing standard library install. The pip
module currently marks the install as changed regardless, causing a
restart of OpenStack services during every playbook run.

Change-Id: I8be207c359388d00b34448318bc17c8b0039c4db
"}, {'created': '2018-10-31 11:48:26.000000000', 'message': "Pin argparse for idempotent pip installs

Argparse is part of the Python standard library in 2.7 but is still
an unmarked and unpinned downstream dependency of some packages
(unittest2==1.1.0 for example).

Ubuntu's libpython2.7-stdlib package includes an argparse.egg-info file
setting its version to 1.2.1.

The python_venv_build process will try to build and install the latest
version of argparse available in PyPI, 1.4.0, but this will never
actually install over the existing standard library install. The pip
module currently marks the install as changed regardless, causing a
restart of OpenStack services during every playbook run.

Change-Id: I8be207c359388d00b34448318bc17c8b0039c4db
"}]
commit_message:
Pin argparse for idempotent pip installs

Argparse is part of the Python standard library in 2.7 but is still
an unmarked and unpinned downstream dependency of some packages
(unittest2==1.1.0 for example).

Ubuntu's libpython2.7-stdlib package includes an argparse.egg-info file
setting its version to 1.2.1.

The python_venv_build process will try to build and install the latest
version of argparse available in PyPI, 1.4.0, but this will never
actually install over the existing standard library install. The pip
module currently marks the install as changed regardless, causing a
restart of OpenStack services during every playbook run.

Change-Id: I8be207c359388d00b34448318bc17c8b0039c4db

commit_message:
Enable magnum to allow load balancers to be in their own subnet

This allows users to specify a different subnet in the feature-gate
argument 'label' of their cluster template to change the subnet of the
loadbalancer resources. Users who do not specify this field will not
notice any change.

Change-Id: I77b616fe7403da40cef3b7f45b2ddf40a26f99b9
Task: 22463
Story: 2002654

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-09 14:27:50.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup make-cert.sh and stage master kube-proxy/kubelet changes

This patch is a readability cleanup for make-cert.sh. There is mostly no
change in what this script does with exceptions to:
1) adding an admin.conf file for users to borrow or kube services to consume.
This is to bring some feature parity to kubeadm and other k8s deployments
2) this generates certs for kube-proxy for another patch where it will be activated.

Change-Id: Ic9640e0d9d7d8299871bf295a228210667dd8715
'}, {'created': '2018-08-09 15:50:42.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup make-cert.sh and stage master kube-proxy/kubelet changes

This patch is a readability cleanup for make-cert.sh. There is mostly no
change in what this script does with exceptions to:
1) adding an admin.conf file for users to borrow or kube services to consume.
This is to bring some feature parity to kubeadm and other k8s deployments
2) this generates certs for kube-proxy for another patch where it will be activated.
3) project-id, cluster-name, and stack-name provided to the heat template for future use
Change-Id: Ic9640e0d9d7d8299871bf295a228210667dd8715
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup make-cert.sh and stage master kube-proxy/kubelet changes

This patch is a readability cleanup for make-cert.sh. There is mostly no
change in what this script does with exceptions to:
1) adding an admin.conf file for users to borrow or kube services to consume.
This is to bring some feature parity to kubeadm and other k8s deployments
2) this generates certs for kube-proxy for another patch where it will be activated.
3) project-id, cluster-name, and stack-name provided to the heat template for future use
Change-Id: Ic9640e0d9d7d8299871bf295a228210667dd8715
