subject: Add option to replace `shell.prompt_for_password`
messages:
[{'account_id': 26250, 'date': '2018-10-10 14:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-11-02 21:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is an interesting idea, but needs some test coverage.  The failure in the -tips job is directly related to this change and needs to be addresses, even though that job is non-voting at the moment.

Also documentation and a release note.'}, {'account_id': 26250, 'date': '2018-11-05 15:03:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This is an interesting idea, but needs some test coverage.  The
 > failure in the -tips job is directly related to this change and
 > needs to be addresses, even though that job is non-voting at the
 > moment.
 > 
 > Also documentation and a release note.

Could you please advise me on where to put documentation and tests? As far as I can see, there's an integration test over in `python-openstackclient` that tests the shell prompting. Additionally, authentication documentation seems to be available in `python-openstackclient` - and this change seems to fit into authentication. To fix the breaking test you mentioned, I'd also need to change `python-openstackclient`(convert the option back to string in the "configuration show" command).
So, do I add release notes here and add documentation, tests and fixes into a commit in `python-openstackclient` that has a dependency to this change?'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 14:45:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to replace `shell.prompt_for_password`

Having the password for openstackclient in the shell environment seems
bad from a security perspective and using randomly generated passwords
is hard, when the user has to to type/retrieve them everytime.

Therefore, this commit adds a new parameter `--os-pw-func` to the shell,
which accepts a callable to import and call instead of
`osc_lib.shell.prompt_for_password`. This makes it possible for users to
implement their own password-retrieval methods e.g. from a password
manager.

Change-Id: Iaa93f6c129eb0bda83d36918c58ee89cfef89e17
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to replace `shell.prompt_for_password`

Having the password for openstackclient in the shell environment seems
bad from a security perspective and using randomly generated passwords
is hard, when the user has to to type/retrieve them everytime.

Therefore, this commit adds a new parameter `--os-pw-func` to the shell,
which accepts a callable to import and call instead of
`osc_lib.shell.prompt_for_password`. This makes it possible for users to
implement their own password-retrieval methods e.g. from a password
manager.

Change-Id: Iaa93f6c129eb0bda83d36918c58ee89cfef89e17

commit_message:
Allow services to provide after_targets directly

Add 'after_targets' as its own key inside a systemd services dictionary
instead of using config_template overrides.

Change-Id: I8d2ae74010c040544b8099f596678acd71e727e9

commit_message:
Sort columns in node detailed list alphabetically

Currently we insert new fields in semi-random place. This change sorts
the columns alphabetically and enforces this order via unit tests.

Also correct the case of the "Automated Clean" heading.

Follow-up to commit dfd341585b3a331df240202b2de80834ae1acc9d.

commit_message:
Follow publish-to-pypi change

The publish-to-pypi-python3 template has been renamed to
publish-to-pypi, so we can update the description of the python3-first
goal.

Leave the original text in a note and explain how this was changed.

Change-Id: I349a721ef3e1ca88b635ff817d3ed7d68adf5aa4
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/615239

commit_message:
add pep8 to tox.ini

Add a separate pep8 environment in tox.ini for linting only the code
changes. We don't need to add the zuul job because flake8 also runs as
part of the linters environment and job.

Change-Id: Ie6bbdfdecef43666cb0eb5d3ff4a34a7067daed2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Done.

I feel user of Dragonflow should be notified on ML about this change. So that they can plan the changes accordingly if needed. 

I am not sure if we have any such pre-requirement about Removing projects from official list like we have for retiring the project[1] But it is good to have a public announcement/notification when any Project mova out of official list and not completely retire.

commit_message:
Remove Dragonflow from the official projects list

Since Dragonflow is no longer maintained, we see no
reason to keep it on the official projects list.
Therefore, we are removing it.

Change-Id: Iee57de1ebd3ac4d2fd73235b205a6695b8798fff

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 10:58:41.000000000', 'message': 'Indicate release style for each repository

The Release Management team is handling release management for
deliverables from all official OpenStack teams. However, there
are a number of exceptions:

- deliverables that are not using tags for their 'release', or
  that are continuously consumed (docs, specs, cookiecutters...)

- deployment deliverables that are released on a specific
  marketplace (Chef supermarket, Charm store...) and for which
  building tarballs and listing them under releases.openstack.org
  would provide no value

To facilitate tracking the intention of the teams for their
deliverables, this change introduces a "release:" key to the
deliverable entries. By default (if the key is not present),
the deliverable would be released using the openstack/release
repository and the Release Management team.

But the key could also contain:

- release: none (the deliverable is not really 'released', no tags
  are applied)

- release: external (the deliverable is published on a separate
  publication platform, this should be reserved for deployment tools)

This change applies the key to already-known exceptions.

Change-Id: I8ffe1de25cc3252a2d9e6acb21f24934c313cfcb
'}, {'created': '2018-10-25 12:19:36.000000000', 'message': 'Indicate release style for each repository

- release: external (the deliverable is published on a separate

Change-Id: I8ffe1de25cc3252a2d9e6acb21f24934c313cfcb

'}, {'created': '2018-10-26 09:52:30.000000000', 'message': 'Indicate relmgt style for each deliverable

The Release Management team is handling release management for
deliverables from all official OpenStack teams. However, there
are a number of exceptions:

- deliverables that are not using tags or branches for their
  'release', or that are directly published (docs, specs,
  cookiecutters...)

- deployment deliverables that are released on a specific
  marketplace (Chef supermarket, Charm store...) and that are
  not relying on the OpenStack release management team help

To facilitate tracking the intention of the teams for their
deliverables, this change introduces a "release-management:"
key to the deliverable entries. By default (if the key is not
present), the deliverable would be handled by the OpenStack
Release Management team using the openstack/release repository.

But the key could also contain:

- release-management: none (the deliverable does not need any
  release management, it does not use tags or series branches)

- release-management: external (the deliverable is published
  on a separate publication platform, and its release is managed
  by its project team directly; this should be limited to corner
  cases like deployment tools)

This change applies the key to already-known exceptions.

Change-Id: I8ffe1de25cc3252a2d9e6acb21f24934c313cfcb
Task: 22262
'}]
commit_message:
Indicate relmgt style for each deliverable

The Release Management team is handling release management for
deliverables from all official OpenStack teams. However, there
are a number of exceptions:

- deliverables that are not using tags or branches for their
  'release', or that are directly published (docs, specs,
  cookiecutters...)

- deployment deliverables that are released on a specific
  marketplace (Chef supermarket, Charm store...) and that are
  not relying on the OpenStack release management team help

To facilitate tracking the intention of the teams for their
deliverables, this change introduces a "release-management:"
key to the deliverable entries. By default (if the key is not
present), the deliverable would be handled by the OpenStack
Release Management team using the openstack/release repository.

But the key could also contain:

- release-management: none (the deliverable does not need any
  release management, it does not use tags or series branches)

- release-management: external (the deliverable is published
  on a separate publication platform, and its release is managed
  by its project team directly; this should be limited to corner
  cases like deployment tools)

This change applies the key to already-known exceptions.

Change-Id: I8ffe1de25cc3252a2d9e6acb21f24934c313cfcb
Task: 22262

commit_message:
Ensure pip/setuptools/wheel are up to date in the wheel build venv

To ensure consistency, we make sure that the venv used for the wheel
build has an up to date and the right versions of pip/setuptools/wheel.

Change-Id: Iac3e5054b5ef482bba2954e40c2c4d32a7f863df
(cherry picked from commit ecff328ed6fdf683ff3eba807b7f50be8ae7103b)

commit_message:
Increase overcloud delete timeout to 10 minutes

We are getting overcloud delete timeouts in periodic jobs, since
it is taking ~7.5 minutes instead of the ~5 minutes it used to take.

As a quick fix while we find out the root cause, let's increase the
timeout to 10 minutes.

Change-Id: I8377536a58bc4af2f34316a85c5dbc449523b85c
Partial-Bug: #1801525

subject: Refactor designate
messages:
[{'account_id': 24, 'date': '2018-10-31 00:50:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2018-11-01 00:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-11-05 13:11:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There are 2 main issues with this patch:

1) The original code (which is in master branch) is written for Designate V1. As far as I know, V1 was deprecated some time ago and doesn't exist now. I was not happy about how V1 works (it was in permanent changing mode), so if you want to work for restring designate support, I prefer to just port the code from V1 to V2 without supporting V1.

2) moving scenario-like class from 'scenario' folder to 'services' doesn't make it looks better. The idea of 'services' is plugin-aware. It means that they were designed to be launched from any place where it is needed (from any plugin- scenario, context, no matter). That is why 'services' doesn't have complex logic in __init__ method and require transmitting random_name generator and etc.

If you are interested in adding support of designate V2, let me know and we will restore designate job."}]

'}]

commit_message:
use include_tasks instead of include

include is marked as deprecated since ansible 2.4[0]

Switch to include_tasks or import_playbook as necessary

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/include_module.html#deprecated

Use NetworkRBAC OVO in neutron/db/external_net_db.py

messages: [{'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-11-04 18:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-11-04 20:32:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-05 10:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-05 11:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck lxc cache prep fail'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-04 18:59:00.000000000', 'message': "Stop creating duplicate lines in lxc config files

The 'Ensure containers have access RO cgroups' will currently add the
same line to an lxc container's config file on every run of the role.

Add a regular expression to the task to check if the line to be inserted
already exists in the file, and if so, don't insert it again.

Change-Id: I5ac57bd59ea943c019dd0a5530c8246284b33269
(cherry picked from commit 296f428b9c7ab0c42cc609e5b63672df64456c38)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop creating duplicate lines in lxc config files

The 'Ensure containers have access RO cgroups' will currently add the
same line to an lxc container's config file on every run of the role.

Add a regular expression to the task to check if the line to be inserted
already exists in the file, and if so, don't insert it again.

Change-Id: I5ac57bd59ea943c019dd0a5530c8246284b33269
(cherry picked from commit 296f428b9c7ab0c42cc609e5b63672df64456c38)

subject: Remove setup.py check from pep8 job
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-05 11:59:44.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.
Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.
More details can be found in this mailing list post:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I18f1a2ea2fb32583c50f513b0d1e33fad7343247
'}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.
Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.
More details can be found in this mailing list post:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I18f1a2ea2fb32583c50f513b0d1e33fad7343247

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and

README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.
Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.
More details can be found in this mailing list post:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: Ib127f9f355fa717aae50d382eac442e6affc7f2a

commit_message:
Explicitly convert X-Target-Insecure to a boolean

We will now only accept the string values "False" or "True". Previously
any given value was interpreted as a string and thus True.

Closes-Bug: #1666565
Change-Id: Ibd105c881dbe16cd4516bfb775c8f5f43c961b45
(cherry picked from commit b16a4ce465f9cadcd1ec65282079c97acafab059)

commit_message:
Increase CI job timeout to 2 hours

If there is a change to kolla then images are built, which can push the
job over the existing 1.5 hour timeout. These jobs are also used in the
kolla CI.

Change-Id: I88a28745cf834376163ced36984c317fce831346
(cherry picked from commit ed8a7b7b89d9c6ecf5f91da819bea9da2cb3ac74)

commit_message:
Use containerized location of ironic inspector.conf for validation

This uses the containerized location of inspector.conf in the dhcp-introspection
validation, it is no longer available at /etc/ironic-inspector/inspector.conf.

Change-Id: Ib08889447017cfc62e5a350eeed4a27cc968c781
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
use context manager from neutron-lib

Access to neutron.db.api's context manager is already in neutron-lib
and in fact neutron is already using it as a shim. This patch switches
over context manager access to use neutron-lib's accessors.
Also see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613122

Change-Id: Ib2dde518197dcc6a5ad9401e48408da8a307d727

commit_message:
Explicitly convert X-Target-Insecure to a boolean

We will now only accept the string values "False" or "True". Previously
any given value was interpreted as a string and thus True.

Closes-Bug: #1666565
Change-Id: Ibd105c881dbe16cd4516bfb775c8f5f43c961b45
(cherry picked from commit b16a4ce465f9cadcd1ec65282079c97acafab059)

commit_message:
Add puppet-mistral-tripleo-standalone job

* It overrrides the tripleo-standalone featureset override to run
  mistral specific tempest tests using mistral tempest plugins.

* It will help to detect the puppet-glance tempest specific issues
  early in gates.

* As mistral plays an important role in driving the tripleo standalone
  deployment.

Change-Id: If0ba2bc7500bce92440cd54ac025ef15d1150b30

subject: Fix POST_FAILURE in CI when ARA DB doesn't exist
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-24 08:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-09-24 10:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2018-09-25 15:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-05 10:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nChason, care to bump your +1 to +2?'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-11-05 10:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-24 08:37:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix POST_FAILURE in CI when ARA DB doesn't exist

If the main CI job fails before generating an ARA report, the SQLite
database file will not exist. This cases the job to fail with
POST_FAILURE, rather than FAILURE, and the following is seen in the
logs:

rsync: change_dir "/home/zuul/.ara" failed: No such file or directory
rsync error: some files/attrs were not transferred (see previous errors)
(code 23) at main.c(1655) [Receiver=3.1.1]
rsync: [Receiver] write error: Broken pipe (32)

This change fixes this by checking for an SQLite database file, and only
intiating the rsync transfer if it exists.

Change-Id: I370e5bc9f137abe552918a3215a025fa61e3a0ca
'}]
commit_message:
Fix POST_FAILURE in CI when ARA DB doesn't exist

If the main CI job fails before generating an ARA report, the SQLite
database file will not exist. This cases the job to fail with
POST_FAILURE, rather than FAILURE, and the following is seen in the
logs:

rsync: change_dir "/home/zuul/.ara" failed: No such file or directory
rsync error: some files/attrs were not transferred (see previous errors)
(code 23) at main.c(1655) [Receiver=3.1.1]
rsync: [Receiver] write error: Broken pipe (32)

This change fixes this by checking for an SQLite database file, and only
intiating the rsync transfer if it exists.

Change-Id: I370e5bc9f137abe552918a3215a025fa61e3a0ca

commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I35beb33fe3d0875f742b46da2b04f6084d1b9c38
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I97c4b98c7825f7f55b1d47db760c5662545c3e38
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Import Zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents
are normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Id3d18f3c30ed3afde34bda917aca9e6d2c89505f

commit_message:
Split off metadata vendordata plugin in own class

A recent change making nova-metadata-api work with wsgi [1] moved
the vendordata plugin parameters to the nova::metadata manifest.
While this is conceptually correct as nova-metadata is the one that
should be using this parameters. In practice the parameters are also
used in compute drivers (in the ironic driver, for instance), thats
why we should split them to be able to deploy nova-metadata-api
separate from nova-compute.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582621/

Change-Id: Ic3654c79d8cf275f0c58d57a4b66e2598450a7ed
Related-Bug: 1799352
(cherry picked from commit 6686406bce9e7fc9623dea130daa3f16c0f93905)

Remove static option from include_tasks

'static' is not a valid option for include_tasks.
include_tasks is always dynamic.

commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: Iea823472cc45ce65e11eb9b096aa5d1d943f5520
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Skopeo based uploader"

The affected mistral workflow takes about 10 minutes to run, but we
timeout as 6 (https://github.com/openstack/python-
tripleoclient/blob/master/tripleoclient/workflows/deployment.py#L52)

About 5 minutes out of that is spent by skopeo inspect stuff.
That needs to be optimized, thus proposed to be reverted.

Closes-Bug: #1789680
Partial-Bug: #1797525

This reverts commit 1fc15b3d967745e22389b2cd18d48db99644b504.

Change-Id: I188f3aabc0f34b79141c607a6d15c48b1dd0ab9f

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and

commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This is covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: Ib62cba6a70e67bdd4dacecc694544c829836bad1
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add puppet-glance-tripleo-standalone job

* It overrrides the tripleo-standalone featureset override to run
  glance specific tempest tests.

* It will help to detect the puppet-glance tempest specific issues early
  in gates.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615178/

Change-Id: Ibcec0829034d968710d7faed9ff733b155bbd2e3

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: If6b6ce5a6ad26c5a9bdc7ec819a1993411b848a4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update the min version of tox to 2.0

The verification comands used by tox need at least 2.0 version. This
patch aims to update tox version from 1.6 to 2.0 which should help with
local running of constraints targets.

Change-Id: Ibc559e0afb3a68d3ce2acfd325e0695c3fae41ad

commit_message:
Use port 5000, keystone-wsgi-public and --http-socket

The present port 35357 and special command keystone-wsgi-admin
are used by v2 API. These have been switched over to the new
port 5000 and public wsgi application, because v2 API is no more
needed and have been removed. Also, uswgi --http is missing
'socket' flag and have been added.

Change-Id: Idae51ff85e6b657a88aa366f65a8d3afdc10b096

commit_message:
Apply Heat rolling upgrade logic

As Heat supports rolling upgrade from Queens, this patchset apply the upgrade
logic follow [1]

The implementation can be better with custom Ansible strategy.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/heat/latest/operating_guides/upgrades_guide.html

Co-author: Ha Manh Dong <donghm@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I38f51f9c38548ac077fd03782df08f2faf178dc3
Implements: blueprint apply-service-upgrade-procedure

subject: Add libxml2 to cinder_distro_packages lists
messages:
[{'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-11-04 16:23:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-11-04 16:29:59.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to reduce-unnecessary-package-installs'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-11-04 17:58:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Do we need to do the same for the other distros? the xslt-dev package was removed as a runtime requirement for all distros here https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614334/.

Interesting also that the role tests didn't seem to pick this up."}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-11-04 18:38:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, makes sense to include this for all distros.

I'm not sure how opensuse and centos were able to continue passing in the integrated gate. Maybe it's already in their base container images?

And It looks like the role test still included the dev packages.
http://logs.openstack.org/43/615443/1/check/openstack-ansible-functional-ubuntu-bionic/1b58246/logs/openstack/cinder/apt/history.log.txt.gz"}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-11-04 18:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-11-04 20:31:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-05 07:36:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Already experienced in the past so yes, good patch, thanks!'}]

Add libxml2 to cinder_distro_packages lists

libxml2 is required by cinder services.

Package lists were also alphabetized.

subject: Use Timesync service instead of Ntp
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-11 10:21:46.000000000', 'message': "Use Timesync service instead of Ntp

At the moment the 'OS::TripleO::Services::Timesync' service is
synonymous to 'OS::TripleO::Services::Ntp'. Let's use the more generic
Timesync service to pick up the new default in the event the value for
'OS::TripleO::Services::Timesync' changes.

This better aligns with the rest of the roles

Change-Id: Ib6b54c003a82df32be87da2877d70374445b025d
"}]
commit_message:
Use Timesync service instead of Ntp

At the moment the 'OS::TripleO::Services::Timesync' service is
synonymous to 'OS::TripleO::Services::Ntp'. Let's use the more generic
Timesync service to pick up the new default in the event the value for
'OS::TripleO::Services::Timesync' changes.

This better aligns with the rest of the roles

Change-Id: Ib6b54c003a82df32be87da2877d70374445b025d

messages:
[{'account_id': 19494, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:45:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-24 07:12:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

lgtm. thanks for showing interest in openstack contribution. 

Feel free to contact us on FirstContact SIG if you want any help to get engaged in particular projects/area contribution. - https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/First_Contact_SIG'}, {'account_id': 9317, 'date': '2018-10-24 11:57:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19494, 'date': '2018-10-24 13:14:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks :)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-11-05 08:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Apply Ansible strategy for rolling upgrade in Cinder

Add the `not_run_all` variable to Cinder handler tasks
to restart Cinder serices in serial nodes, which reduces
the downtime.

The variable `serial_ratio` specifies the percentage of
hosts that will run in a batch. If `serial_ratio` is too
small, the task will be run consecutively on each host.

Depends-On: I4bcfc7ab58ed13e5cdae32396100a76bce28faf6
Change-Id: Ie35c31e3984323b9a0d141a721b4430f9b401764
Implements: blueprint apply-service-upgrade-procedure

commit_message:
DNM: Message IDs in notifications(proof of concept)

Tiny proof of concept that it's possible to also include message ID to
each notification without refactoring Zaqar much.

Possible alternatives to this solution that I can think of:
1. Generate message IDs in the transport layer using uuid.
2. Rename our current pipeline to "input storage layer pipeline" and add
additional "output storage layer pipeline" where we could move our
NotifierDriver.

PS I haven't updated the tests for this proof of concept, so they fail.

Change-Id: Id946372ec4b791e5acf91a4f69d77344f009fab9

looks good almost. Is there any way to avoid fernet related code duplication? And please add a release note.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-24 00:41:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(8 comments)

> looks good almost. Is there any way to avoid fernet related code
 > duplication? And please add a release note.

I've marked a few places that are reasonably clear duplication (there is more), but the issue is that we'd need to extract a lot of that code from tokens into somewhere generic as a base for tokens and receipts. I don't want to touch token code in this patch so that should probably happen as a follow up since duplication is easy to clean up later.


The part that we probably do need to solve before we merge this is should tokens/receipts each have their own fernet keys? Is there much of a benefit there? The default I've done is to reuse token fernet keys, but allow the option to split. If we go with this then change our mind how hard is it to deprecate config setting later?

If we opt to permanantly merge the two, then we really ought to consider dropping:
keystone/conf/fernet_receipts.py
keystone/conf/fernet_tokens.py

into a generic:
keystone/conf/fernet.py

But I'm not sure how we'd handle that deprecation/config change nicely. Is a release note enough?"}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-10-25 13:09:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(8 comments)

> (8 comments)
 > 
 > > looks good almost. Is there any way to avoid fernet related code
 > > duplication? And please add a release note.
 > 
 > I've marked a few places that are reasonably clear duplication
 > (there is more), but the issue is that we'd need to extract a lot
 > of that code from tokens into somewhere generic as a base for
 > tokens and receipts. I don't want to touch token code in this patch
 > so that should probably happen as a follow up since duplication is
 > easy to clean up later.

What if we just agree that a receipt is a degenerate form of token and have the receipt model, formatter, and provider just inherit from the token stuff? (Morgan how do you feel about that?)

 > 
 > 
 > The part that we probably do need to solve before we merge this is
 > should tokens/receipts each have their own fernet keys? Is there
 > much of a benefit there? The default I've done is to reuse token
 > fernet keys, but allow the option to split. If we go with this then
 > change our mind how hard is it to deprecate config setting later?
 > 
 > If we opt to permanantly merge the two, then we really ought to
 > consider dropping:
 > keystone/conf/fernet_receipts.py
 > keystone/conf/fernet_tokens.py
 > 
 > into a generic:
 > keystone/conf/fernet.py
 > 
 > But I'm not sure how we'd handle that deprecation/config change
 > nicely. Is a release note enough?

oslo.config has nice utilities for emitting deprecation warnings, so it's not a big deal. But for the sake of simplicity I might prefer to use the same settings and then add more settings later if we need to."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-29 01:14:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-29 01:22:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-29 03:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-29 04:01:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

So we have two options for handling the duplication... we can either do it before, or after this patch.

Before will mean another patch to make the token elements generic, and then rebase this on top of that and have it use those elements since I really don't want to touch tokens in the same patch.

Or we merge this, and then do a follow up to remove the duplication as we see fit once we have both in place. The duplication isn't ideal, but it's easier fix later if we decide it is important enough to do than than trying to juggle two patches for what probably shouldn't be a blocker (but that's not me choice to make).


As for the state of the patch... I *think* I've addressed almost everything now, and the unit tests are all now ported over from the last patch.

While the unit tests run I'll go over all the comments and see if I've missed anything."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-29 04:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-29 04:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-29 06:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-29 10:21:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-29 22:08:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I don't understand the federation failures :/

Unrelated?"}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-10-30 21:31:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)

> So we have two options for handling the duplication... we can
 > either do it before, or after this patch.
 > 
 > Before will mean another patch to make the token elements generic,
 > and then rebase this on top of that and have it use those elements
 > since I really don't want to touch tokens in the same patch.
 > 
 > Or we merge this, and then do a follow up to remove the duplication
 > as we see fit once we have both in place. The duplication isn't
 > ideal, but it's easier fix later if we decide it is important
 > enough to do than than trying to juggle two patches for what
 > probably shouldn't be a blocker (but that's not me choice to make).

I'm not sure I agree that it's out of scope to handle it in this patch, but if you want to deal with it after this patch I can live with that.

 > 
 > 
 > As for the state of the patch... I *think* I've addressed almost
 > everything now, and the unit tests are all now ported over from the
 > last patch.
 > 
 > While the unit tests run I'll go over all the comments and see if
 > I've missed anything.

I had a couple of unaddressed comments about the CLI.

This will need a release note, do you want to add it to this patch or to https://review.openstack.org/580535 ?"}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-30 22:35:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > > So we have two options for handling the duplication... we can
 > > either do it before, or after this patch.
 > >
 > > Before will mean another patch to make the token elements
 > generic,
 > > and then rebase this on top of that and have it use those
 > elements
 > > since I really don't want to touch tokens in the same patch.
 > >
 > > Or we merge this, and then do a follow up to remove the
 > duplication
 > > as we see fit once we have both in place. The duplication isn't
 > > ideal, but it's easier fix later if we decide it is important
 > > enough to do than than trying to juggle two patches for what
 > > probably shouldn't be a blocker (but that's not me choice to
 > make).
 > 
 > I'm not sure I agree that it's out of scope to handle it in this
 > patch, but if you want to deal with it after this patch I can live
 > with that.

I mostly just don't want to over-complicate this patch, and doing it after this patch would be easier/cleaner once we decide on what that cleanup should look like (e.g. are receipts just a lesser form of tokens).

 > 
 > >
 > >
 > > As for the state of the patch... I *think* I've addressed almost
 > > everything now, and the unit tests are all now ported over from
 > the
 > > last patch.
 > >
 > > While the unit tests run I'll go over all the comments and see if
 > > I've missed anything.
 > 
 > I had a couple of unaddressed comments about the CLI.
 > 
 > This will need a release note, do you want to add it to this patch
 > or to https://review.openstack.org/580535 ?

This patch is better. Will add that now."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-10-31 00:52:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-11-02 14:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-11-02 14:08:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Addressed a nit about the release note.

Let's go ahead with this to avoid making this patch too complicated. We still need an api-ref update, an API version increment, deduplication, and ideally some proper MFA docs."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-11-02 16:44:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(5 comments)

See in-line comments.

A few other notes:
I would encourage dropping the pluggability of the receipt provider (leave the scaffolding, but we don't need it pluggable atm) and make sure we get documentation on the MFA Rules and UserOptions."}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-11-05 04:33:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Is fernet_rotate tested somewhere in keystone CI jobs?

I am seeing some authentication issues and i think this patch is causing issue, i am seeing this in puppet deployment[1] where fernet_rotate is running under cron(*/10 * * * * keystone-manage fernet_rotate)[2], Can someone check if this patch needs some additional configuration or the patch has some issue and needs some fix.

[1] https://centos.logs.rdoproject.org/weirdo-generic-puppet-openstack-scenario001/6726/weirdo-project/logs/testr_results.html.gz

[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/blob/master/manifests/keystone.pp#L51-L54'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-11-05 07:43:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> Is fernet_rotate tested somewhere in keystone CI jobs?
 > 
 > I am seeing some authentication issues and i think this patch is
 > causing issue, i am seeing this in puppet deployment[1] where
 > fernet_rotate is running under cron(*/10 * * * * keystone-manage
 > fernet_rotate)[2], Can someone check if this patch needs some
 > additional configuration or the patch has some issue and needs some
 > fix.
 > 
 > [1] https://centos.logs.rdoproject.org/weirdo-generic-puppet-openstack-scenario001/6726/weirdo-project/logs/testr_results.html.gz
 > 
 > [2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/blob/master/manifests/keystone.pp#L51-L54

yatin, do you have any keystone logs, or potentially can you see what the unauthorised response says?

In theory nothing in those tests should touch anything this code does unless it uses MFA rules.

And looking at keystone-puppet, it is calling 'fernet_rotate' which should be rotating both receipt and token keys, and should work even if the directories aren't the defaults:
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-keystone/blob/master/manifests/cron/fernet_rotate.pp#L69"}]

commit_message:
Implement auth receipts spec

Adds a new model and provider for receipts which are
very similar to tokens (fernet based), and share the
same fernet mechanisms.

Adds changes to the auth layer to handle the creation,
validation, and consumptions of receipts as part of
the auth process.

Change-Id: Iccb6e6fc7aee57c58a53f90c1d671402b8efcdbb
bp: mfa-auth-receipt

commit_message:
trivial: Don't run integration tests on tools/.* updates

This adds an entry to irrelevant-files to skip running integration
tests following changes to files under tools/.* because nothing
under there effects integration tests.

Change-Id: I3235ef51defb9d70dec564bdfa63dca6264c0d63

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-30 06:30:03.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I27f049fcae3ea31b010e651a8067d059fff7dbe2
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I27f049fcae3ea31b010e651a8067d059fff7dbe2

commit_message:
Purge soft-deleted trusts

This patch adds the functionality for purging both
expired trusts as well as non-expired soft-deleted
trusts, since those soft-deleted trusts are
as likely to bloat the database as expired trusts.

Related to patch-
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589378/

Change-Id: I3c74f2345a944ce03a8189c4e66c3c37350cd34f
Related-Bug: #1473292
(cherry picked from commit 6aba78a7a213335bf38ddfb4c0e1ef329653305e)

messages: [{'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-10-12 05:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2018-10-12 11:04:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19350, 'date': '2018-10-17 06:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-11-05 05:46:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1\n\nlet me merge rocky branch related patches'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-12 05:47:17.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ic5a105dee3e13b63d0f21caf59cd0ef2fa791096
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ic5a105dee3e13b63d0f21caf59cd0ef2fa791096

subject: Allocation/Deallocation API Specification
messages:
[{'account_id': 25738, 'date': '2018-08-30 05:43:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17813, 'date': '2018-08-30 06:10:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25738, 'date': '2018-08-30 06:17:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Thanks for your comments.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-30 07:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17813, 'date': '2018-08-30 09:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25738, 'date': '2018-09-17 06:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25738, 'date': '2018-09-17 07:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25738, 'date': '2018-09-27 03:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-09-27 23:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

The Cyborg API for allocations should be addressed as part of the overall flow between Nova and Cyborg. That is already taken up in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603955/. What do you see as the role of this spec?'}, {'account_id': 27458, 'date': '2018-10-03 01:35:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Sundar Nadathur, I think this spec discribes what should be happening when nova invoke the allocation/deallocation apis on the Cyborg side.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-10-05 16:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Li_Liu: This is not in alignment with either the API signatures in the Nova spec or with what we want in the implementation. Another Cyborg spec is in the works that will address those details.'}, {'account_id': 14131, 'date': '2018-10-08 06:12:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Sundar
This spec only focus on the Allocation/Deallocation.
Detail implementation.
By convention, we need a spec for every API.  

Anyway, it is necessary for accelerator binding.. 

If you think this is good enough, please give comments and let's address it."}, {'account_id': 14131, 'date': '2018-10-08 06:12:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

s/ this is good enough/ this is not good enough'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-10-16 18:20:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This has been discussed offline; responding here for completeness. 

Cyborg APIs need to be related to the overall Nova-Cyborg flow. If ‚Äòallocation‚Äô means binding, it does not take a device profile as a parameter. That is passed in a previous step. Also, while this spec does not say what exactly gets allocated, it implies that it is allocating a Deployable. That is not how it works: Nova chooses a device RP and Cyborg will use the corresponding Deployable. Also, when proposing an API, the signature of the API must be included.

Please see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/608624/.'}, {'account_id': 25738, 'date': '2018-11-05 06:21:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

there is another spec https://review.openstack.org/#/c/608624 about Cyborg API which matches better with current design.'}]
